items: The Musical Weapon damage increases by 1d6 and your spell attack and save dc increases by 1.

items.name: Song of The Forest
entries: While holding the instrument, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it using your spellcasting ability without requiring material components: {@spell faerie fire}, {@spell mass cure wounds} (6th level), {@spell lesser restoration}, or {@spell greater restoration}. Once a spell has been cast, that spell can't be cast from the instrument again until the next dawn.

items.name: Song of War
entries: You can bolster your allies with the songs of battle. As bonus action you can give a number of allies up to your charisma modifier temporary hit points equal to your level. While they have these temporary hit points, they are immune to being charmed or frightened and have advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. You can use this song a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and cannot use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Exalted
entries: When the instrument reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The Musical Weapon damage increases by 1d6 and your spell attack and save dc increases by 1.

items.name: Song of Restoration
entries: As an action you can begin a song of continuous healing. For the next minute, you and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you restores 2d6 hit points at the start of each of their turns. Once you use this song, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Song of Retribution
entries: As a bonus action you can begin a song that leaves a path of destruction for any who dare to harm the wilderness. For the next minute, you and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you receives a bonus to their damage rolls equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this song, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Protector's Grove
entries: You can cast the Druid Grove spell once with this instrument without requiring material components or spending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so again the next dawn.

item.name: The Bow of Judgement (Dormant)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with a lawful alignment
entries: {@note Forged by the old god of death, this powerful bow swiftly takes the lives of anyone in its sights, so long as its wielder wishes it so. This deadly bow was entrusted to a tiefling who understood the weight of such power and the responsibilities that came with it. The tiefling Yumiko, who swore to only kill those deserving, took this legendary bow and used it to smite all evil that was unfortunate enough to fall under their keen eye.}

entries.name: Necrotic Ammunition
entries: By pulling back the bowstring of this weapon you can make your own ammunition without the need of having any in your possession. When you do so however, the bow does 1d6 necrotic damage instead of 1d8 of piercing. You do not add your dexterity modifier to the damage roll of attacks made with this ammunition. If you do use normal ammunition for the bow, you deal an additional 1d6 necrotic damage on hit.

entries.name: Sight of Judgement
entries: As an action you can shift your focus onto the soul of a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a Wisdom (Insight) check contested against their Charisma (Deception) check. On a success, you learn that creature's alignment and creature type. On a failure, you learn nothing. You can use this special sense twice, regaining all expended uses at the next dusk.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The longbow grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

items.name: Death Shot
entries: When you hit a creature with this magic weapon you can deal a lethal blow. The creature makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, on a failed save the creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. On a success it takes half as much damage and does not suffer any additional effects. Once you've used Death Shot, you cannot do so again until the next dusk.

items.name: Mark of Death
entries: Choose one creature you can see within the long range of the bow, a shadowy mark appears on them, leaving an opening for you to exploit. While marked, you ignore resistance to necrotic damage the target has. In addition, they take an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage when you deal damage to them with this bow. Once you've marked a creature, you cannot do so again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Heroic Weapon Properties
entries: While attuned to the artifact in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the longbow reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2. Both the extra necrotic damage and the damage dealt by your Necrotic Ammunition increases by {@damage 1d6}.
You can use Death Shot and Mark of Death twice per dusk instead of once.
A creature hit by this bow while they are marked by your mark of death, they cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.
The save DC for Death Shot becomes 17 instead of 15.

items.name: Soul Shattering Shot
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can turn all of the damage from this attack into force damage and the creature makes a DC 17 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 6d6} force damage and are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. If they cannot be {@condition stunned}, they are instead {@condition incapactiated} and their movement speed is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn. On a success, they take half damage and suffer no additional effects. Once you've used Soul Shattering Shot you cannot use it again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the longbow reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3. Both the extra necrotic damage and the damage dealt by your Necrotic Ammunition increases by {@damage 1d6}.
You can use Homing Shot and Mark of Death three times per dusk instead of twice.
The save DC for Death Shot and Soul Shattering Shot becomes 19 instead of 17.
You ignore immunity and any reductions to necrotic damage on creatures who are marked by your mark of death.

items.name: Slaying Shot
entries: When you score a critical hit using this weapon and their remaining hit points after the attack is 100 or fewer, that creature must make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature dies. On a success, the creature instead takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. You can use this slaying shot three times and you regain all uses at the next dusk.

item.name: The Hammer of the Allfather (Dormant)
item.reqAttune: by a creature it deems worthy
entries: {@note When the world shakes, it can be one of two things. An earthquake, or this mighty hammer has been swung. This hammer's weight is incalculable to those unworthy of its might, but weightless to its true wielders. The original wielder of this mighty warhammer, Iryoku, was chosen by the allfather himself to wield this mighty earth-shaking weapon to defend the dwarven kingdom to his last dying breath.}

entries.name: Dwarven Endurance
entries: This warhammer counts as a {@item Belt of Dwarvenkind|DMG}, gaining its properties in addition to its own, except the Constitution score increase maximum is 22 instead of 20.

entries.name: Might of The Dwarvish Lords
entries: Only a creature attuned to this warhammer can gain the benefit of its light property. Otherwise it counts as a heavy weapon. Being worthy of this hammer grants you a might stronger than the sturdiest steel walls. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The warhammer grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

items.name: Flames of the Forge
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

items.name: Powerful Strikes
entries: Each time you hit a creature with this weapon they must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet. Each blow lets out a thunderous boom that can be heard from 100 feet away.

items.name: Quaking Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force them to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. Once you've used this property you cannot do so again until the next dawn. Regardless of the save, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Heroic Weapon Properties
entries: While attuned to the artifact in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the warhammer reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2. The extra fire damage you deal with Flames of the Forge increases by {@damage 1d8}.
You can use Quaking Strike twice per dawn instead of once.
The save DC for Powerful Strikes and Quaking Strike becomes 17 instead of 15.

items.name: Flames of The Allfather
entries: As an action, you can cast the following spells from the warhammer with a spell save DC of 17: {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (5th level), {@spell fireball} (5th level), {@spell flame strike}, and {@spell immolation|XGE}. Once a spell has been cast using the warhammer, that spell can't be cast from the warhammer again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the warhammer reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
You can use Quaking Strike three times per dawn instead of twice.
The save DC for Powerful Strikes, Quaking Strike, and the spells cast from this warhammer becomes 19 instead of 17.

items.name: Allfather's Hand
entries: While holding the warhammer, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it with a spell save DC of 19 and a +11 spell attack bonus: {@spell bigby's hand}, {@spell earthquake}, and {@spell move earth}. Once a spell has been cast using the warhammer, that spell can't be cast from the warhammer again until the next dawn.

items.name: Might of The Allfather
entries: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 2. While wielding this warhammer, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. In addition, if an effect moves you against your will along the ground, you can use your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved to 0.

item.name: The Sword of Legend, Excalibur (Dormant)
item.reqAttune: by a creature the sword deems worthy
entries: There is an inscription written on the blade of this weapon. The inscription is written in Celestial: {@note "He who shall wield the hilt of this legendary blade; shall possess the courage and strength of the greatest hero known to mankind. The sealer of darkness and king of men, Excalibur."}

Also known as the sword of evil's bane, the darkness sealing blade, arms of the true king, and many other names. This sword is forged by the holiest of steel and righteous gold mined from Mount Celestia. Its power reverberates in its wielder's hand, and has the strength to harm even the mightiest of foes. Only they who should ever be worthy can release the blade from its prison. Even the gods cannot break the seal on this artifact.

This longsword belonged to the legendary hero Adam Alexandr. Excalibur was the name he donned after choosing to become a hero instead of a ruler. The weapon chooses who can attune to it and who can't. It desires a wielder who embodies bravery, compassion, and heroism.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The sword allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest. The first time you attune to the sword, you are transformed into a heavenly, idealized version of yourself, blessed with otherworldly beauty and a touch of heaven in your heart. Neither magic nor divine intervention can reverse this transformation. Your alignment becomes lawful good, and you gain the following traits:

items.name: Angelic Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Celestial}.

items.name: Celestial Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.

items.name: Divine Body
entries: Your Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, and Wisdom scores increases by 2, and your Charisma increases by 4. The maximum any of your ability scores can be when increasing them with ability score improvements or feats becomes 24.

entries.name: Holy Light
entries: The sword sheds 5ft of dim light. Whenever you hit with a weapon attack using this sword, the sword deals an additional {@damage 1d10} amount of radiant damage. This damage becomes {@damage 2d10} against an evil aligned creature.

The sword's holy glow becomes brighter the closer you are to an evil aligned creature. When you are within 10 ft of a creature with an evil alignment, the sword sheds 5 ft of bright light and dim light for an additional 5 ft. The sword tells its wielder telepathically who or what the evil creature is when it detects it. A magic item or spell that blocks divination magic blocks this ability.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The longsword grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

items.name: Evil's Bane
entries: As an action, you can subdue evil's might using this legendary sword. Choose any number of evil aligned creatures you can see within 10 feet of you, those creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 10 feet of you for the next minute. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Divine Protection
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell protection from evil and good} spell using this sword without spending a spell slot or requiring material components. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until the next dawn. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

items.name: Divine Might
entries: You can use your charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls of this weapon instead of strength or dexterity.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: In its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} and {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the longsword reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2 and both damage bonuses from its Holy Light increases by {@damage 1d10}.
You can use Evil's Bane and Divine Protection twice per dawn instead of once.

items.name: Divine Sword
entries: As a bonus action, you can cast the holy weapon spell with a spell save DC of 20, targeting only the sword. When you cast holy weapon using the sword, you do not need to concentrate on it.

items.name: Angelic Wings
entries: You sprout a beautiful pair of feathered wings that grant you a flying speed of 90 feet and the ability to hover. If you already have a different kind of wings, these new wings replace the old ones, which fall off.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the longsword reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3. The damage dealt by this longsword ignores any resistance and immunities when dealing damage to an evil aligned creature.
You can use Evil's Bane and Divine Protection three times per dawn instead of twice.

items.name: Eyes of the Divine
entries: Your eyes become luminous pools of silver. You gain {@sense truesight} out to a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Evil's Opposition
entries: While holding the longsword, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 20): {@spell holy aura}, {@spell imprisonment}. Once a spell has been cast using the longsword, that spell can't be cast from the longsword again until the next dawn. You can cast {@spell imprisonment} with its original casting time instead. An evil creature automatically fails the saving throw for {@spell imprisonment}, but only if you cast it using its full casting time instead of an action. For the purposes of the imprisonment, the creature is sealed within the sword and cannot be released by any means short of a properly worded {@spell wish}, even so there is a 30 percent chance the wish can fail.

item.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Dormant)
entries: Legends tell of a blade as old as the world itself, some say as old as time. Before creation comes ruin, and ruin is what created this weapon. Forged by a mortal with the power of the Gods of Old in the eye of a never-ending storm, let no evil touch this blade; lest you bring ruin and the end of all things. This weapon has been an heirloom in the Blade Family for countless generations, its name given by its original owner, Ragnarok. The Blade family is a long line of heroes that focuses on compassion and love to all walks of life. Striking down the unredeemable ones, hoping they are reborn better. Lending a hand to those in need, to those who seek redemption, and to those that cannot protect themselves.

A powerful hum can be heard from the weapon. A creature that meditates in front of the blade will hear the ambience of a thunderstorm, and may even see visions of a powerful hero that now lies dormant within the blade. The blade itself radiates electricity with the might of a dragon.

entries.name: Spirit of Ragnarok
entries: A voice can be heard from the blade from time to time. While attuned with the weapon you can communicate with the spirit inside the blade, Ragnarok. Ragnarok is a genius with magic, and knows just about anything about it. No matter how hard, rare, or impossible the magic may be to know, he knows about it to some degree. Though, unless absolutely necessary he will not share all of his knowledge. The most cursed of magic he'll keep to himself unless encountered with it, or if a weakness needs to be known. Ragnarok is kind and benevolent. If he finds that his wielder becomes tainted or cursed, he will ensure that they either become pure again, or grants them a swift painless death so they no longer suffer from the sins they would regret later in life.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, and Primordial.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The katana grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Auran and Draconic.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and it deals an extra 1d8 lightning damage to any target it hits. Immediately after you make a ranged attack with this weapon, it flies back to your hand. You can also call the weapon using a bonus action.

{@b Lightning Absorption.} As a reaction, whenever you are targeted by a spell, magical effect, or attack (not originating from you) that would deal lightning damage, you can instead reduce that damage to 0, and regain hit points equal to the original amount. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.
You can spend an action to cast the {@spell fly} spell but only targeting yourself. This property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Heroic Weapon Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to this artifact in its dormant state, the attuned creature gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the artifact reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Awakened)

_copy.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Dormant)

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the katana reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2, and the extra lightning damage dealt by the weapon increases to {@damage 2d8}.
This weapon counts as a {@item Staff of Thunder and Lightning|DMG}, gaining its properties, but keeping its original statistics.

While holding the katana, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 17, +9 to hit): {@spell lightning bolt} (6th level), {@spell chain lightning}, {@spell storm sphere|XGE}, or {@spell call lightning} (6th level). You can use your own spellcasting ability if you have one when casting these spells. Once a spell has been cast using the katana, that spell can't be cast from the katana again until the next dawn.

item.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Exalted)

_copy.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Awakened)

items.name: Exalted
entries: When the katana reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
The lightning absorption property can be used three times before the next dawn.
The saving throw DC for the weapon's special properties and spells cast from the weapon increases to 19 and the spell attack becomes + 11.
While holding the katana, you can use an action to cast {@spell control weather} from it. You can use your own spellcasting ability if you have one when casting these spells.

item.name: Tear of Phestoth (Dormant)
entries: This crystalline shard of ice takes the shape of a large teardrop. Echoes of a crying silver dragon can sometimes be heard within it. While attuned with this crystal, it also counts as a {@item Dragon-Touched Focus|FTD}. It starts in its Stirring state, but progressively evolves further as the attuned creature awakens the artifact.

entries.name: Slumbering Dragon
entries: As an action, a creature attuned to this artifact can summon the {@creature pseudodragon|MM} sleeping within the focus. It has the familiar trait and instantly bonds with its summoner. It can return to the focus and be re-summoned from it at any time. Its summoner retains the benefits of the familiar trait even while it is within the focus. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, it returns to the focus and cannot be summoned again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the Tear of Phestoth in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Destroying the Artifact
entries: If the artifact is taken to the highest peak of the world during a total solar eclipse, it is overwhelmed by magic and destroyed.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The focus grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You have a +1 bonus to your spell attack bonus and your spell save DC.
When you cast a spell that deals cold damage, you can roll {@dice 1d8} and add it to one of the damage rolls of the spell.

items.name: Breath of The Frozen Wastes
entries: As an action, you can hold up this focus and release outward a 30-foot cone of freezing wind. Each creature in its area needs to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, they take {@damage 6d6} cold damage and their speed is reduced to 0 on a failed save, or half as much on a success and their speed is only halved.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the focus reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +2 bonus to your spell attack bonus and your spell save DC.
When you cast a spell that deals cold damage, you can roll {@dice 2d8} and add the total to one of the damage rolls of the spell.
The damage of the Breath of the Frozen Wastes property of this focus becomes {@dice 8d6}.
This artifact also counts as a {@item Wakened Dragon-Touched Focus|FTD}.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the focus reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +3 bonus to your spell attack bonus and your spell save DC.
The damage of the Breath of the Frozen Wastes property of this focus becomes {@dice 10d6}.
You have immunity to cold damage.
This artifact also counts as an {@item Ascendant Dragon-Touched Focus|FTD}.

item.name: Mark of The Golden Phoenix (Dormant)
entries: This magical tattoo is found in the form of ashes in a golden urn, which were produced by a slain phoenix that held enormous power.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the urn with both hands and allow the ashes to slowly form onto your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, remaining almost perfectly still throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the urn turns to dust and further coats the ashes, then it all turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo. If you are attuned to other magic tattoos, you can combine their attunement with your attunement to this tattoo, making them each count as one item for the purposes of attunement. You can only combine up to three tattoos in this way, including this one.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the urn reappears in your space with the ashes inside.

entries.name: Fiery Immortality
entries: If a creature attuned to this item dies, their attunement to this artifact does not instantly end. Instead their body releases an explosion of fire in a 30-foot-radius. Each creature in the area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 4d10} fire damage, or half as much on a success. Their body is then destroyed, reduced to a golden ash, which sheds dim light in a 5-foot-radius. They maintain their initiative count, even after they die.

Using their normal statistics, after they die they make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. On a success, they return to life at the start of their next turn with 1 hp. On a failed save, they lose their initiative count and instead return to life at the next dawn.

entries.name: Illumination
entries: As a bonus action, a creature attuned to this item can wreath themselves with fire and shed bright light out to a maximum range of 60 feet, and dim light for up to an additional 60 feet. They can adjust how far this light extends or extinguish the flames as a bonus action.

entries.name: Sacred Fire
entries: The phoenix these ashes came from was a creature of mixed heritage, an offspring between an archangel and an elder phoenix. As a result, the flames from this creature were mixed with a divine light. When you deal fire damage, after applying any bonuses to it, you can change the damage type to radiant.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The tattoo grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You have a +1 bonus to your spell attack bonus and your spell save DC.
When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can roll {@dice 1d10} and add it to one of the damage rolls of the spell.

items.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the tattoo in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the tattoo reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +2 bonus to your spell attack bonus and your spell save DC.
When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can roll {@dice 2d10} and add the total to one of the damage rolls of the spell.

items.name: Fiery Magic
entries: The artifact allows you to cast spells as if it were a {@item bracelet of fire|TACS}, having the same number of charges and recharging at the same rate, except it uses your spell save DC and spell attack bonus.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the tattoo reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +3 bonus to your spell attack bonus and your spell save DC.

items.name: Fire Immunity
entries: You have immunity to fire damage.

items.name: Dancing Phoenix
entries: You can cast the fire storm spell from this artifact using your spell save DC. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until the next dawn. The spell takes the form of a flaming phoenix flying around, wreathing flames in the area of the spell.

items.name: Summon Phoenix
entries: As an action, you can call upon the aid of a powerful {@creature phoenix|MPMM}. It appears in a space near you at an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. It takes its turns after yours and can act on its own, or it can obey your commands (no action required). It vanishes when it falls to 0 hit points, and it doesn't use its Fiery Death and Rebirth trait. Once you summon a Phoenix from this artifact, you cannot summon it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Shield of The Frozen North (Dormant)
entries: This magical shield is made out of pure ice, extremely cold to the touch. It exudes with abjuration magic that protects its wielder and allies of their choosing.

entries.name: Frozen Guidance
entries: As a bonus action, a cold wind can be released from the shield and surround a target of the wielder's choosing within 60 feet of them (they can choose themselves). The chosen target is granted 1d10 plus the wielder's spellcasting ability modifier temporary hit points. These temporary hit points can be granted twice, regaining all expended uses at the next dawn.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The shield grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You have a +1 bonus to your ac and saving throws.

items.name: Icy Protection
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of you takes cold damage, you can use your reaction to grant them resistance to that damage until the start of their next turn.

items.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the shield in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the shield reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +2 bonus to your ac and saving throws.
You can use your Frozen Guidance feature four times per dawn and it gives an additional 1d10 temporary hit points.

items.name: Cold Magic
entries: The artifact allows you to cast spells as if it were a {@item staff of frost}, having the same number of charges and recharging at the same rate, except you don't risk losing the artifact if you expend the last charge.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the shield reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +3 bonus to your ac and saving throws.
You can use your Frozen Guidance an unlimited number of times.

items.name: Cold Immunity
entries: You have immunity to cold damage and your Icy Protection gives the target immunity to cold damage rather than resistance.

item.name: Blades of The Twin Dragons (Dormant)
entries: These two katanas have sharp emerald blades that are psionically linked to each other and their wielder, making it easier to wield both at the same time.

entries.name: Duality
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting using both of these katanas, you can make one additional attack using one of these weapons when you take the attack action.

entries.name: Blade Stance
entries: As a bonus action, you can change your fighting stance to give yourself one of the following effects, provided you are wielding both weapons, which lasts until the start of your next turn:

items.name: Twin Parry
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your AC.

items.name: Twin Slash
entries: Your melee attacks have advantage, provided you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll.

items.name: Dancing Blades
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The katanas grants the following benefits in their dormant state:

items: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic weapons.

items.name: Psionic Blades
entries: When you hit with these magic weapons, you deal an additional {@damage 1d8} psychic damage.

items.name: Psionic Resilience
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the katanas in their dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

items: Blades of The Twin Dragons (Dormant)|TACS
Blades of The Twin Dragons (Awakened)|TACS
Blades of The Twin Dragons (Exalted)|TACS

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the katanas reach an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic weapons.

Your blade stances improve, the bonus to your AC while Twin Parry is active becomes +2, while Twin Slash is active your attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} slashing damage, and your movement speed increase while Dancing Blades is active becomes 20 feet.

items.name: Twin Mind
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the katanas reach an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic weapons.
The extra psychic damage from your Psionic Blades property becomes {@damage 2d8}.

items.name: Twin Mind
entries: You have immunity to psychic damage and you are immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

item.name: Mark of The Jester
entries: This magical tattoo takes the shape of a musical instrument. While the tattoo is on your body, you may use it as a spellcasting focus for your bard spells and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC and your spell attack bonus. Music can play from your tattoo akin to the instrument its shape takes, which you can change the shape of as an action. You still make a performance check as usual when attempting to perform with the tattoo.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.
The tattoo has 5 charges, which you can use for the following feature. The tattoo regains all of its charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: When you have no uses of your bardic inspiration, you can expend a charge to use a d6 in place of a bardic inspiration for the use of your Bard features which use your bardic inspiration.

item.name: Mark of The Champion
entries: This magical tattoo takes the shape of a weapon. While the tattoo is on your body, you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with weapons that match the shape of the tattoo. You can change the shape of this tattoo as an action.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.
The tattoo has 10 charges, which you can use for the following features. The tattoo regains all of its charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Champion's Spirit
entries: When you have no uses of your second wind, you can expend a charge to use the feature again.

entries.name: Champion's Strike
entries: When you hit with a weapon attack, you can expend a charge to deal an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage.

entries.name: Champion's Surge
entries: When you have no uses of your indomitable or action surge features, you can spend 2 charges to use them instead.

item.name: Mark of The Berserker
entries: This magical tattoo takes the shape of a furious creature. While the tattoo is on your body, you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with strength-based attacks.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.
The tattoo has 10 charges, which you can use for the following features. The tattoo regains all of its charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Fury of the Berserker
entries: While you are raging and you hit with a strength-based attack, you can expend a charge to deal an additional {@damage 1d10} force damage and push them back 5 feet away from you.

entries.name: Unrelenting Rage
entries: While you are raging, as a bonus action you can expend a charge to roll a hit die and regain hit points as if you were taking a short rest. Doing so does not expend the hit die.

entries.name: Infectious Rage
entries: When you enter your rage, you can expend 2 charges from this tattoo to grant up to two creatures within 5 feet of you the ability to enter a rage, just like yours.

item.name: Mark of The Arcane Child
entries: This magical tattoo takes the shape of an arcane symbol, or a shape that resembles your sorcerous origin. While the tattoo is on your body, you can use it as a spellcasting focus and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC and spell attack bonus.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.
The tattoo has 5 charges, which you can use for the following features. The tattoo regains all of its charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Sorcerous Well
entries: When you use a feature that would expend one or more sorcery points, you can spend a charge from this tattoo for the cost instead.

entries.name: Powerful Spells
entries: When a creature would succeed a saving throw against one of your sorcerer spells, you can expend a charge to turn it into a failure instead.

item.name: Mark of The Scholar
entries: This magical tattoo takes the shape of a spellbook, with an arcane symbol associated with your arcane tradition. While the tattoo is on your body, you can use it as a spellcasting focus and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC and spell attack bonus.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.
The tattoo has 10 charges, which you can use for the following feature. The tattoo regains all of its charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Unexpected Wizardry
entries: As an action, you can attempt to cast a wizard spell you do not know or have recorded in your spellbook using your own spell slots. Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check against a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If you fail, the spell slot is wasted.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Memori Lyre
entries: While holding this lyre, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your bard spells.

An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Memori Lyre can be used to cast {@spell dimension door}, {@spell tenser's transformation|XGE}, and {@spell power word heal}.

itemGroup.name: Robe of Elemental Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear these robes. You have resistance to one type of damage while you wear these elemental robes. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below.
In addition, while not wearing armor you are always under the effects of the {@spell mage armor} spell.

Robe of Icy Defense|TACS
Robe of Fiery Defense|TACS
Robe of Shocking Defense|TACS

Robe of Thunderous Defense|TACS

itemGroup.name: Songsheet of the Bards
entries: This magical song sheet has musical notes and patterns that only a bard can understand, which contains bard spells of a particular level. Whispers can be heard from it, a master seeking a child of the arcane to teach. A bard can learn spells on the song sheet by spending a number of hours equal to the spell's level of which they wish to learn. These spells don't count against the total number of spells the bard can know. Once a spell has been learned from the song sheet, the spell disappears from it. Once there are no spells remaining on the song sheet, it loses its magic and becomes an ordinary sheet of paper.
A songsheet typically comes with ({@dice 2d4}) {@filter bard|spells|class=bard} spells on it, the level of these spells determines the rarity of the item. The spells are chosen by the DM.

itemGroup.name: Scroll of Wizardry
entries: This magical parchment has complicated algorithms only a wizard can understand, which contains wizard spells of a particular level. Whispers can be heard from it, a master seeking a child of the arcane to teach. A wizard can learn spells on the scroll by spending a number of hours equal to the spell's level of which they wish to learn. These spells don't count against the total number of spells the wizard can know. Once a spell has been learned from the scroll, the spell disappears from it. Once there are no spells remaining on the scroll, it loses its magic and becomes an ordinary sheet of paper.
A scroll typically comes with ({@dice 2d4}) {@filter wizard|spells|class=wizard} spells on it, the level of these spells determines the rarity of the item. The spells are chosen by the DM.

A sorcerer can learn spells on the scroll by spending a number of hours equal to the spell's level of which they wish to learn. entries: This magical parchment has arcane writing and eldritch phrasing only a warlock can understand, which contains warlock spells of a particular level. Whispers can be heard from it, a master seeking a child of the arcane to teach. A warlock can learn spells on the scroll by spending a number of hours equal to the spell's level of which they wish to learn. These spells don't count against the total number of spells the warlock can know. Once a spell has been learned from the scroll, the spell disappears from it. Once there are no spells remaining on the scroll, it loses its magic and becomes an ordinary sheet of paper.
A scroll typically comes with ({@dice 2d4}) {@filter warlock|spells|class=warlock} spells on it, the level of these spells determines the rarity of the item. The spells are chosen by the DM.

itemGroup.name: Shield of The Frozen North
entries: This magical shield is made out of pure ice, extremely cold to the touch. It exudes with abjuration magic that protects its wielder and allies of their choosing.

entries.name: Frozen Guidance
entries: As a bonus action, a cold wind can be released from the shield and surround a target of the wielder's choosing within 60 feet of them (they can choose themselves). The chosen target is granted 1d10 plus the wielder's spellcasting ability modifier temporary hit points. These temporary hit points can be granted twice, regaining all expended uses at the next dawn.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the tattoo in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

itemGroup.name: Blades of The Twin Dragons
entries: These two katanas have sharp emerald blades that are psionically linked to each other and their wielder, making it easier to wield both at the same time.

entries.name: Duality
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting using both of these katanas, you can make one additional attack using one of these weapons when you take the attack action.

entries.name: Blade Stance
entries: As a bonus action, you can change your fighting stance to give yourself one of the following effects, provided you are wielding both weapons, which lasts until the start of your next turn:

items.name: Twin Parry
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your AC.

items.name: Twin Slash
entries: Your melee attacks have advantage, provided you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll.

items.name: Dancing Blades
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Artifact Properties

When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. itemGroup.name: Tear of Phestoth
entries: This crystalline shard of ice takes the shape of a large teardrop. Echoes of a crying silver dragon can sometimes be heard within it. While attuned with this crystal, it also counts as a Dragon-Touched Focus. It starts in its Stirring state, but progressively evolves further as the attuned creature awakens the artifact.

entries.name: Slumbering Dragon
entries: As an action, a creature attuned to this artifact can summon the {@creature pseudodragon|MM} sleeping within the focus. It has the familiar trait and instantly bonds with its summoner. It can return to the focus and be re-summoned from it at any time. Its summoner retains the benefits of the familiar trait even while it is within the focus. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, it returns to the focus and cannot be summoned again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the Tear of Phestoth in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

entries.name: Destroying the Artifact
entries: If the artifact is taken to the highest peak of the world during a total solar eclipse, it is overwhelmed by magic and destroyed.

itemGroup.name: Mark of The Golden Phoenix
entries: This magical tattoo is found in the form of ashes in a golden urn, which were produced by a slain phoenix that held enormous power.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the urn with both hands and allow the ashes to slowly form onto your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, remaining almost perfectly still throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the urn turns to dust and further coats the ashes, then it all turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo. If you are attuned to other magic tattoos, you can combine their attunement with your attunement to this tattoo, making them each count as one item for the purposes of attunement. You can only combine up to three tattoos in this way, including this one.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the urn reappears in your space with the ashes inside.

entries.name: Fiery Immortality
entries: If a creature attuned to this item dies, their attunement to this artifact does not instantly end. Instead their body releases an explosion of fire in a 30-foot-radius. Each creature in the area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 4d10} fire damage, or half as much on a success. Their body is then destroyed, reduced to a golden ash, which sheds dim light in a 5-foot-radius. They maintain their initiative count, even after they die.

Using their normal statistics, after they die they make a DC 20 Charisma saving throw. On a success, they return to life at the start of their next turn with 1 hp. On a failed save, they lose their initiative count and instead return to life at the next dawn.

entries.name: Illumination
entries: As a bonus action, a creature attuned to this item can wreath themselves with fire and shed bright light out to a maximum range of 60 feet, and dim light for up to an additional 60 feet. They can adjust how far this light extends or extinguish the flames as a bonus action.

entries.name: Sacred Fire
entries: The phoenix these ashes came from was a creature of mixed heritage, an offspring between an archangel and an elder phoenix. As a result, the flames from this creature were mixed with a divine light. When you deal fire damage, after applying any bonuses to it, you can change the damage type to radiant.

entries.name: Artifact Properties
entries: While attuned to the tattoo in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. itemGroup.name: The Blade of The Neverending Storm
entries: Legends tell of a blade as old as the world itself, some say as old as time. Before creation comes ruin, and ruin is what created this weapon. Forged by a mortal with the power of the Gods of Old in the eye of a never-ending storm, let no evil touch this blade; lest you bring ruin and the end of all things. This weapon has been an heirloom in the Blade Family for countless generations, its name given by its original owner, Ragnarok. The Blade family is a long line of heroes that focuses on compassion and love to all walks of life. Striking down the unredeemable ones, hoping they are reborn better. Lending a hand to those in need, to those who seek redemption, and to those that cannot protect themselves.

A powerful hum can be heard from the weapon. A creature that meditates in front of the blade will hear the ambience of a thunderstorm, and may even see visions of a powerful hero that now lies dormant within the blade. The blade itself radiates electricity with the might of a dragon.

entries.name: Spirit of Ragnarok
entries: A voice can be heard from the blade from time to time. While attuned with the weapon you can communicate with the spirit inside the blade, Ragnarok. Ragnarok is a genius with magic, and knows just about anything about it. No matter how hard, rare, or impossible the magic may be to know, he knows about it to some degree. Though, unless absolutely necessary he will not share all of his knowledge. The most cursed of magic he'll keep to himself unless encountered with it, or if a weakness needs to be known. Ragnarok is kind and benevolent. If he finds that his wielder becomes tainted or cursed, he will ensure that they either become pure again, or grants them a swift painless death so they no longer suffer from the sins they would regret later in life.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, and Primordial.

items: The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Dormant)|TACS
The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Awakened)|TACS
The Blade of The Neverending Storm (Exalted)|TACS

itemGroup.name: The Dragon's Song
entries: Through the forest there are many melodies to be heard, from the soft winds to the falling petals. The forest's true beauty is through the senses of the beholder. This lyre was forged by the goddess of nature for the protector of her domain. Her chosen champion.

entries.name: Voice of the Forest
entries: Whispers can be heard from this artifact. You can cast the spell {@spell Commune with Nature} using the instrument as the focus for the spell. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand  Elvish, Primordial, and Sylvan.

entries.name: Protector's Soul
entries: A creature attuned to this item gains the power to protect their allies. As a reaction when a creature other than you takes damage within 60 ft of you, you can choose to reduce that damage to 0. When you do so, you receive a token of burden. The next time you would take damage while you have a token of burden, you take twice the amount of damage you would have normally taken and the token of burden is lost.

entries.name: Musical Weapon
entries: The music played by The Dragon's Song can be focused into magical attacks. As an action, make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 60 ft of you using your spell attack modifier. On hit, you deal 1d6 plus your charisma modifier thunder damage.

entries.name: Flexible Instrument
entries: The Dragon's Song can take the shape of any musical instrument of your choice, changing its form requires a bonus action. If you have attuned to an instrument of the bards before of any variety, you can change The Dragon's Song into that magic item, granting The Dragon's Song the properties of that instrument in addition to its own properties but only when it takes the form of that instrument.

entries.name: Heroic Weapon Properties
entries: While attuned to the artifact in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

The Dragon's Song (Awakened)|TACS
The Dragon's Song (Exalted)|TACS

itemGroup.name: The Bow of Judgement
itemGroup.reqAttune: by a creature with a lawful alignment
entries: {@note Forged by the old god of death, this powerful bow swiftly takes the lives of anyone in its sights, so long as its wielder wishes it so. This deadly bow was entrusted to a tiefling who understood the weight of such power and the responsibilities that came with it. The tiefling Yumiko, who swore to only kill those deserving, took this legendary bow and used it to smite all evil that was unfortunate enough to fall under their keen eye.}

entries.name: Necrotic Ammunition
entries: By pulling back the bowstring of this weapon you can make your own ammunition without the need of having any in your possession. When you do so however, the bow does {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage instead of {@dice 1d8} of piercing. You do not add your dexterity bonus to the damage roll of attacks made with this ammunition. If you do use normal ammunition for the bow, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage on hit.

entries.name: Sight of Judgement
entries: As an action you can shift your focus onto the soul of a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a Wisdom (Insight) check contested against their Charisma (Deception) check. On a success, you learn that creature's alignment and creature type. On a failure, you learn nothing.
You can use this special sense a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus regaining the ability to use it again at the next dawn.

entries.name: Heroic Weapon Properties
entries: While attuned to the artifact in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

The Bow of Judgement (Awakened)|TACS
The Bow of Judgement (Exalted)|TACS

itemGroup.name: The Hammer of the Allfather
itemGroup.reqAttune: by a creature it deems worthy
entries: {@note When the world shakes, it can be one of two things. An earthquake, or this mighty hammer has been swung. This hammer's weight is incalculable to those unworthy of its might, but weightless to its true wielders. The original wielder of this mighty warhammer, Iryoku, was chosen by the allfather himself to wield this mighty earth-shaking weapon to defend the dwarven kingdom to his last dying breath.}

entries.name: Dwarven Endurance
entries: This warhammer counts as a {@item Belt of Dwarvenkind|DMG}, gaining its properties in addition to its own, except the Constitution score increase maximum is 22 instead of 20.

entries.name: Might of The Dwarvish Lords
entries: Only a creature attuned to this warhammer can gain the benefit of its light property. Otherwise it counts as a heavy weapon. Being worthy of this hammer grants you a might stronger than the sturdiest steel walls. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries: While attuned to the artifact in its dormant state, the wierlder gains one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.
