entries: A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) the infused item.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Solution

item: a bottle, flask, or waterskin

entries: This container becomes laced with chemicals that when mixed with water has restorative properties. The container has 4 charges. A creature can spend a charge to drink from the container as a bonus action or administer it to another creature as an action. When the water from it is consumed, the creature regains {@dice 2d4} hit points. A creature can also spend 2 charges as an action to drink from it and regain {@dice 4d4} hit points. The container regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Homunculus Servant

item: A gem or crystal worth at least 100 gp

entries: You learn intricate methods for magically creating a special {@creature Homunculus Servant|TCE|homunculus} that serves you. The item you infuse serves as the creature's heart, around which the creature's body instantly forms.
You determine the homunculus's appearance. Some artificers prefer mechanical-looking birds, whereas some like winged vials or miniature, animate cauldrons.

The homunculus is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Homunculus Servant stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the homunculus can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.
The homunculus regains {@dice 2d6} hit points if the {@spell mending} spell is cast on it. If you or the homunculus dies, it vanishes, leaving its heart in its space.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Attachment

item: A simple or martial weapon (requires attunement)

entries: You can enhance your weapons with magical technology. This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
In addition, you can make one of the following adjustments to the weapon:

items.name: Scope
entries: The magic weapon gains an additional +1 bonus to ranged attack rolls made with the weapon.

items.name: Serrated Edge
entries: The magic weapon gains an additional +1 bonus to damage rolls made with melee attacks using the weapon.

items.name: Guard
entries: This magic weapon gives the wielder a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Construct

item: a small object, or multiple tiny objects

entries: An assistant is made out of scrap metal and wood, which must be enough to be at least as large as a small creature and no larger) which transforms it into an animate golem. Refer to the {@creature Magitech Construct|TACS} stat block. The creature with the infusion is the construct's master.

It shares its master's initiative, but takes its turn right after them. They can command the construct as a bonus action, otherwise it uses its turn to dodge or give the help action. It can, however, move on its own and respond to quick verbal issues regarding movement.
Once it is reduced to 0 hit points, it shuts down and cannot be activated again until the next dawn, which has it regain all of its hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Gadget

item: A Tiny Object

entries: A tiny object is infused with unique mechanics, allowing it to have new properties making it into a sort of omni-tool gadget. When a feature refers to "you", it refers to the original owner of the item being infused. If a feature requires a saving throw, it uses the Artificer's spell save DC. If it calls for adding an Intelligence modifier, it always uses the Artificer's Intelligence modifier. Choose up to two of the following features:

items.name: Thrown
entries: You can throw the object as an action or a bonus action, to a maximum range of 60 feet. If you are making an improvised attack using this, it has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet and you make the attack using either Strength or Dexterity for its attack and damage rolls.

items.name: Explosive
entries: You can attach this object on any flat surface, or on the ground (difficult terrain or otherwise), or just drop the object safely. You can arm the explosive as an action or bonus action by expending a spell slot. Once armed, choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The item explodes with powerful energy in a 10-foot radius sphere. Every creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 damage of the chosen type, plus an additional 1d6 for every slot level above 1st. On a success, they take half as much damage. After the explosion, the item is destroyed.

items.name: Grappling Hook
entries: The item can emit a thread made of silvery magical energy with a hook on the end. The thread can extend up to 50 feet to anchor yourself while climbing, as you would with a climber's kit. You can make an improvised ranged attack to attempt to grapple a creature on hit with an escape DC equal to your spell save DC. You can use Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls for this improvised attack. The thread emitted from this can extend the point of origin for the other features provided by this infusion, except the thrown feature.

items.name: Repellent
entries: You can emit a foul odor to those around you. The object emits a 10-foot radius sphere of stench centered from it. Each creature (other than yourself) that starts its turn within the area or enters the area for the first time must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature must use its reaction and spend all of its remaining movement to move away from the object. A creature immune to the poisoned condition is immune to this effect.

items.name: Sticky
entries: You can stick this gadget onto a creature, placing it on their clothing, armor, or a weapon. Against an unwilling creature, you make a Strength or Dexterity improvised attack. A creature can use their action to attempt to remove the object stuck to them or stuck to another creature or object by succeeding on a Strength (Athletics) ability check against your Artificer spell save DC. You can release a creature or object from the sticky adhesive as a bonus action.

items.name: Dungeoneer
entries: You can use this object to make disarming traps and picking locks easier. When making a Dexterity ability check with thieves' tools, you can add a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

items.name: Parachute
entries: When you would take fall damage, you can eject a cushion or parachute out of the object, halving the damage you would take from the fall.

items.name: Hidden Restraint
entries: You can treat the object as a set of {@item manacles|PHB}. You can lock and unlock the manacles freely without needing a key using an action or bonus action. While locked on a creature, they are {@condition restrained}.

items.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: You can use an action to have the object open a tiny latch which emits a large amount of smoke, covering a 20-foot radius sphere of heavily obscured area. A heavy breeze can blow the smoke away, otherwise it disperses after 1 minute. The object loses this feature after it has been used and regains it after you complete a long rest.
Choose 3 features instead of 2 and any range specifications are doubled when you reach 10th level in this class. Also at 10th level, the following options are added to choose from:

items.name: Spell Disruptor
entries: As a bonus action, you can activate or deactivate the spell disruptor, emitting a zone of magical energy that disrupts other magical energies or canceling it. Every creature within 5 feet of the object cannot concentrate on spells. If it were already concentrating on a spell, it loses concentration.

items.name: Tracker
entries: You can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While activated, you always know the location of the tracker, so long as it is on the same plane of existence. Any magic that blocks divination magic also blocks the tracker if the tracker is on the creature or object cloaked by that magic.

items.name: Speed Force
entries: The magic emitting from this object can increase your speed. Your speed is increased by 10 feet. You can use a bonus action to negate the benefits of this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Tool

item: A Tool

entries: While holding this tool, a creature gains a +1 bonus to ability checks made with it. If the wielder uses the tool as an arcane focus for their class, they apply the same bonus to their spell attack bonus and spell save DC.
The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Sharpener

item: A suit of armor or robes

entries: The infused item can send a jolt to the wearer to refocus their mind. The item has 4 charges. When the wearer fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, the wearer can use its reaction to expend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The weapon becomes a hilt which needs to be activated in order to use it. While holding it, the wielder can take a bonus action to cause it to activate, revealing a shining blade made of light, forming the original snape of the weapon. They can also activate it when they draw this weapon. They can deactivate it as a bonus action.
While activated, the weapon's deals radiant damage instead of its normal damage and sheds bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

The weapon has 6 charges. As a reaction immediately after being hit by an attack, the wielder can expend 1 charge and cause the attacker to be {@condition blinded} until the end of the attacker's next turn, unless the attacker succeeds on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Shot

item: A simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the loading property if it has it.

If the weapon lacks ammunition, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when the wielder makes a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic item. You can learn this infusion multiple times; each time you do so, choose a magic item that you can make with it, picking from the Replicable Items tables below. A table's title tells you the level you must be in the class to choose an item from the table. Alternatively, you can choose the magic item from among the {@filter common magic items|items|type=!potion;!scroll|rarity=common} in the game, not including potions or scrolls.

In the tables, an item's entry tells you whether the item requires attunement. See the item's description in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG} for more information about it, including the type of object required for its making.

entries.caption: Replicable Items (2nd-Level Artificer)
rows: Barrier Tattoos* (up to {@item Barrier Tattoo (Small)|TCE|small} at 2nd level, up to {@item Barrier Tattoo (Medium)|TCE|medium} at 5th level, and  {@item Barrier Tattoo (Large)|TCE|large} at 9th level)

optionalfeature.name: Returning Weapon

item: A simple or martial weapon with the thrown property

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Cannon

item: An object that can be used as a spellcasting focus or a simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: If applied to a weapon with the ammunition property, it counts as a spellcasting focus for the wielder's spells. While holding this item, a creature gains a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and their spell save DC. In addition, when the wielder casts a spell of 1st-level or higher that deals damage, they can roll one additional damage die of the spell's damage and add it to one of the damage rolls of the spell.
The number of additional damage dice becomes two when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Shot

item: a simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack. When a creature hits a target with it, the ammunition explodes from the point of impact in a 5-foot-radius centered on the target. Each creature within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking two rolls of the weapon's damage die on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The initial target has disadvantage on the save.

optionalfeature.name: Gauntlets of Recovery

item: a set of gloves or gauntlets

entries: These magical gauntlets have 6 charges. As an action, a creature can expend one or more charges to touch a creature that is not a construct or undead and have them regain 1d8 hit points for each charge spent. They also add their proficiency bonus to the total. The gauntlets regain {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Vehicle

item: a medium or larger object

entries: A land vehicle is formed using a medium, large, huge, or gargantuan object. It has 20 hit points, plus an additional 20 for every size category above medium. It has a damage threshold of 5, plus an additional 5 for every size category above large. It has an AC of 15, plus 1 for every size category above medium. When creating this vehicle, a number of creatures can fit on it based on its size, creating a seat for each designated creature. Tiny creatures, so long as they can fit within a creature's space, can also occupy that same space. Two small humanoids can fit in one medium humanoid's space, though it is a tight squeeze.

entries.name: Medium
entries: 1 medium humanoid or two small humanoids.

entries.name: Large
entries: 1 large humanoid, two medium humanoids, four small humanoids.

entries.name: Huge
entries: 1 large humanoid, four medium humanoids, six small humanoids.

entries.name: Gargantuan
entries: There is not a limit to the occupancy, but it is dependent on the original size of the object. Confer with the DM when making a gargantuan sized vehicle.

The land speed of the vehicle is 50 feet and can travel for 8 hours without needing a charge, which it fully charges on the next dawn. It has a travel pace of 5 miles per hour, allowing it to travel 40 miles in a day on a single charge. The artificer can expend a spell slot to add a number of hours to the travel time equal to the slot's level.

When you reach 10th level in this class, the vehicle no longer needs to be charged and its speed becomes 100 feet. Its hit points and damage threshold is also doubled. Also, you can reduce its land speed to 50 feet and give it an air or water speed of 50 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Paralyzing Solution

item: a bottle, flask, or waterskin

entries: This container becomes laced with chemicals that when mixed with water has poisonous properties. This container has 4 charges. A creature can use a bonus action to expend a charge and coat their weapons with these toxins. The next time they hit a creature with the weapon while coated with these toxins, it enters the target's body and forces them to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the attacker's next turn. A creature who drinks the solution automatically fails the save and becomes paralyzed for a number of rounds equal to the number of charges that were remaining. The container regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot

item: a simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack. When a creature makes an attack with this weapon, they can choose up to three creatures within the range of the weapon that form a straight line. If the first attack hits, re-roll the attack for the second target, but with a -2 penalty. If that attack hits, then re-roll the attack for the final target, but with a -4 penalty. If all three attacks hit, or until the first miss, roll one set of damage and apply it to all the targets that hit. This attack only uses one piece of ammunition.

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Shield

item: A shield (requires attunement)

entries: A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wielding this shield.

The shield has 4 charges. While holding it, the wielder can use a reaction immediately after being hit by a melee attack to expend 1 of the shield's charges and push the attacker up to 15 feet away. The shield regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Resistant Armor

item: A suit of armor (requires attunement)

entries: While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Spell-Refueling Ring

item: A ring (requires attunement)

entries: While wearing this ring, the creature can recover one expended spell slot as an action. The recovered slot can be of 3rd level or lower. Once used, the ring can't be used again until the next dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Helm of Awareness

item: A helmet (requires attunement)

entries: While wearing this helmet, a creature has advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, the wearer can't be surprised, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Protective Mask

item: a helmet, mask or similar face-wear (requires attunement)

entries: While wearing this mask, a creature can breathe normally in any environment, and they have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as cloudkill and stinking cloud effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

optionalfeature.name: Shattering Shot

item: a simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and when a creature lands a critical hit with it, it deals one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage.
When you reach 10th level in this class, it deals one more additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage on a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Missile Launcher

item: A simple or martial weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the loading or reloading properties if it has either. The weapon's damage becomes force instead of its original damage type while it has this infusion, and it deals an additional weapon damage die on hit.

If the weapon lacks ammunition, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when the wielder makes a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Propulsion Armor

item: A suit of armor (requires attunement)

entries: The wearer of this armor gains these benefits:

items: The wearer's walking speed increases by 5 feet.

The armor includes gauntlets, each of which is a magic melee weapon that can be wielded only when the hand is holding nothing. The wearer is proficient with the gauntlets, and each one deals {@damage 1d8} force damage on a hit and has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When thrown, the gauntlet detaches and flies at the attack's target, then immediately returns to the wearer and reattaches.
The armor can't be removed against the wearer's will.
If the wearer is missing any limbs, the armor replaces those limbshands, arms, feet, legs, or similar appendages. The replacements function identically to the body parts they replace.

optionalfeature.name: Cauldron of Many Healing

item: a cauldron or pot (require attunement)

entries: This magical cauldron can hold up to 2 gallons of liquid, which can be used to mass produce healing potions. When using the cauldron to make healing potions, you can craft up to 32 {@item potion of healing|DMG|potions of healing}, 16 {@item potion of greater healing|DMG|greater healing potions}, 8 {@item potion of superior healing|DMG|superior healing potions}, or 4 {@item potion of supreme healing|DMG|supreme healing potions} in the time it would take to make one of the same variety.
Once the cauldron has been used 3 times, you have to wait 30 days until you can use it again, even if this infusion has been reapplied to a different item.

optionalfeature.name: Chain-Targeting Focus

item: An object that can be used as a spellcasting focus (requires attunement)

entries: While holding this item, a creature gains a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and their spell save DC. In addition, when the wielder casts a spell with a range other than self or touch that deals damage or gives healing, but only targets a single creature, it can choose two other creatures within 5 feet of the initial target to be affected by the spell. You make additional attack rolls if necessary, or the new targets make a saving throw if necessary.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Concoction

item: a bottle, flask, or waterskin

entries: This container becomes laced with chemicals that when mixed with water has deadly properties. This container has 1 charge. A creature can coat their weapon with this concoction as a bonus action, which causes their weapon to flare up in a black flame. The next time they hit with the weapon coated with this black flame, the target takes an additional 6d6 necrotic damage and cannot regain hit points for the next minute. A creature who drinks from the container automatically takes the damage and cannot regain hit points for one minute. The container regains its charge daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Integrated Weapon

item: a suit of armor and a simple or martial weapon that lacks the two-handed property (requires attunement)

entries: A suit of armor with a weapon integrated into it, which folds out of or folds back into when the wearer calls for it (no action required). The wearer receives an additional +1 bonus to AC while wearing this suit of magic armor and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. The weapon cannot be removed from the wielder's hand or from the armor against the wearer's will.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Guardian

item: a large object made of iron

entries: A golem is shaped out of a mass of iron to serve as a guardian for its master, which is the one who holds the infusion. The holder of the infusion has a special amulet they wear which aids in controlling the construct and serves for the function of its bound trait. Use the {@creature shield guardian|MM} stat block for its statistics and abilities. Once it is reduced to 0 hit points, it shuts down and cannot be activated again until the next dawn, which has it regain all of its hit points.
The shield guardian shares its initiative with its master, but takes its turns immediately after them. When created, and daily at dawn, it also gains 20 temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Conduit

item: a set of metal bracers (requires attunement)

entries: While wearing these magic bracers, the creature can recover one expended spell slot as an action. The recovered slot can be of 5th level or lower. Once used, the bracers can't be used again until the next dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Guardian

item: a large object made of iron

entries: A golem is shaped out of a mass of iron to serve as a guardian for its master, which is the one who holds the infusion. Use the {@creature magitech guardian|TACS} stat block for its statistics and abilities. Once it is reduced to 0 hit points, it shuts down and cannot be activated again until the next dawn, which has it regain all of its hit points.
The magitech guardian shares its initiative with its master, but takes its turns immediately after them. When created, and daily at dawn, it also gains 10 temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Solution

item: a bottle, flask, or waterskin

entries: This container becomes laced with chemicals that when mixed with water has powerful properties. The container has 6 charges. A creature can drink from it as a bonus action to gain a momentary surge of power, giving them advantage on their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw for the next minute, or until they use it. The container regains {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Volley Shot

item: A martial or simple weapon with the ammunition property (requires attunement)

entries: This magic weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and when a creature makes an attack roll with it they can choose up to three different creatures within 15 feet of the initial target as part of the same attack, spending additional ammunition as needed.

optionalfeature.name: All Knowing Eyes
entries: You learn the {@spell identify} spell and can cast it once without requiring components or spending a spell slot. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Instead of having a range of touch, you can identify an object so long as you can see it and is within 30 ft. Once you cast this spell, you cannot cast it again until you finish a short or long rest. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast this spell using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components and range to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Body
entries: Your body becomes riddled with patches of dragon scales, granting you natural armor. While you are not wearing armor your AC equals 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can still gain the benefits of a shield.
In addition, your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to the levels you have in this class and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonsong
entries: You gain proficiency in two musical instruments of your choice and proficiency in the  Performance skill, or one other skill if you already had proficiency in Performance.

As a bonus action you can evoke the power of your Dragonsong for 1 minute so long as you are not wearing medium or heavy armor. While active, your Dragonsong gives a +1 bonus to your AC and Dexterity Saving throws. You cannot use your Dragonsong again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sight of the Land and Seas
entries: You gain a tremorsense of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Draconic Senses
entries: You gain 60 ft of darkvision. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Magi Drakes
entries: You learn the {@spell detect magic} spell and can cast it once without requiring components, regaining the usage of it after a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Treasure
entries: You can detect whether or not gold or magical items are within 30ft of you, but not how much or where specifically. This sense does not properly function if the treasure is worth less than 50 gp in value, or if it is protected by divination magic or if it is wrapped in a thin sheet of lead.

optionalfeature.name: Graceful Fall
entries: You can magically summon forth gales of wind powerful enough to stop your fall. You learn the {@spell feather fall} spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Heritage
entries: Regardless of your race, you can take any racial feat that requires a dragonborn, half dragon, or other similar races.

optionalfeature.name: Abstract Origins
entries: Your ancestry was more prominent with dragon-kind than you initially believed, while you do not gain the natural resistances of both worlds, you have multiple dragon-kind in your history. Choose one additional Draconic Origin. You do not gain any additional proficiencies or resistances, but you can now take feats or Draconic Powers with prerequisites requiring that Draconic Origin.

In addition, if a feature would reference the damage type you resist from your Draconic Origin, you can choose to use the damage type of either your original origin or the new one every time you use the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Sigils
entries: You've learned how to use special sigils to protect yourself and your belongings. By spending 10 minutes you can magically scribe these sigils onto any object big enough to fit them. In order for a sigil to be active, a creature must attune to it as they would a magic item, but this does not count as an attuned magic item nor does it count against your attunement slots. You have three sigils, a creature can only be attuned to one sigil at a time, any attempt to attune to a different sigil ends the attunement on the previous one. If you die, every sigil you've carved becomes inactive unless you are revived and are dead for no longer than 24 hours. If you are revived within 24 hours of your death, the sigils become active again without requiring attunement.

entries.name: Sigil of Storage
entries: This sigil can be stored on any stone or container. Simply tap an item onto the object with the sigil, and it vanishes into an extradimensional space. This space can store up to 100 lbs worth of items. If more than 100 lbs is in use, the object shatters and all the items stored within it drop within 5 ft of the destroyed object. If creatures are occupying that space, they take 2d10 bludgeoning damage. You cannot have an object with an extradimensional storage, such as a bag of holding or similar item inside of an object with the sigil of storage.

entries.name: Sigil of Protection
entries: This sigil can go on any tiny object that can be worn or carried. This object provides a +1 to AC or saving throws (you choose upon attunement). If the attuned creature takes damage, this benefit is subsided until the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Sigil of Warning
entries: If something in your possession is taken without your knowledge, you get an alarm from your head warning you that something is wrong. You do not know what is immediately taken, only that something is missing. In addition, while you are asleep you get a mental ping if a creature comes within 10 ft of you.

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of the Dragon Kin
entries: You have an astute memory and can recall lore quicker than a scholar. You have advantage on Intelligence ability checks used to recall history, lore, or information on magical creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Legacy
entries: Your draconic blood comes from a dragon from either the Abyss or the Nine Hells. You have resistance to damage from fiends and you do not suffer the negative effects of being in the Abyss or the Nine Hells. In addition, regardless of your race you can take any of the racial feats that have a prerequisite for tiefling, or any race with origins from the Abyss or Nine Hells.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Sea Serpent
entries: You can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you already had a swimming speed, it increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Tundra Walker
entries: You've become naturally adept to the frozen climates. You ignore difficult terrain accustomed to frozen wastelands or extremely cold environments, along with any detrimental effects that follows.

In addition, you've learned how to use these frozen environments to your advantage. You learn the Armor of Agathys spell and while in one of the aforementioned environments, you can cast it at its lowest level at will, without spending a spell slot or requiring material components. Otherwise, you can cast it once without spending a spell slot and cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast this spell using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

otherSummary.entry: Crystal, White, or Silver Draconic Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Crystal, White, or Silver Draconic Origins

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Sparks
entries: Lighting coils around your body, making every moment feel electrifying. As a bonus action you summon your Draconic Sparks for 1 minute. While active, your movement speed increases by an amount of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus. In addition, if you take the dash action creatures you move within 5 feet of for the first time on your turn take an amount of lighting damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Once you've used your Draconic Sparks feature, you cannot use it again until you have finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Feedback
entries: You magically store energy obtained whenever you are struck by your foes, eventually you release it outward in a powerful blast. Each time you take damage, you store a charge of Kinetic Energy. You can have a maximum number of Kinetic Energy points equal to your proficiency bonus. As an action, you can spend all of your Kinetic Energy points to release outward a powerful shockwave. Every creature within 5ft of you makes a Strength saving throw (dc equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your constitution modifier.) or takes a number of d10 lighting damage equal to the number of Kinetic Energy points spent and is pushed back a number of feet equal to 10 times the amount of Kinetic Energy points spent. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not pushed.
Once you've used your Kinetic Feedback feature, you cannot use it again until you have finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Breath
entries: Your Draconic Breath Weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and poisons creatures who fail their save. The poisoned creatures are poisoned for 1 minute and repeat their saving throws at the end of each of their turns, ending the poison on a success.

otherSummary.entry: Draconic Breath Weapon, Green Draconic Origin
otherSummary.entrySummary: Draconic Breath Weapon, Green Draconic Origin

optionalfeature.name: Cloud Nine
entries: You can magically sit on clouds. Also, as an action you can magically produce a special cloud that you and your allies can ride on for 10 minutes. Up to two medium sized creatures can fit on this cloud. The cloud has a flying speed of 30 ft and can hover, but it cannot ascend any higher than 30 ft off the ground or it loses form. Moving the cloud is a bonus action on your turn.
You can magically produce this cloud a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Endurance
entries: Your metallic scales makes you a tougher foe to fight in martial combat. If you are hit by a weapon attack, as a reaction you can reduce the amount of damage you take by 1d10 plus your proficiency bonus.
After you've used your Metallic Endurance twice, you cannot use it again until you've finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Influence
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma ability check or saving throw, you can choose to make the roll at advantage.
Once you've used your Chromatic Influence twice, you cannot use it again until you've finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Psychic Step
entries: As a bonus action you can magically teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of you. You can use this bonus action twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Blessing
entries: Gem dragons harness the divine powers of the long lost Sardior, having origins from these dragons offers you the same blessing of divine magic. You learn the {@spell magic stone|XGE} cantrip and can cast it at will. In addition you learn {@spell color spray} and one 1st level spell from the artificer or wizard spell lists. You can cast either spell without using material components, even costly ones. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Blessing
entries: Chromatic dragons harness the divine powers of Tiamat, having origins from these dragons offers you the same blessing of divine magic. You learn the thaumaturgy cantrip and can cast it at will. In addition you learn chromatic orb and one 1st level spell from the sorcerer or warlock spell lists. You can cast either spell without using material components, even costly ones. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: You're a Wizard, Dragon
entries: A magical spell book appears into your hands. As a bonus action, you can send this spellbook into an extradimensional space and vice versa. You learn one cantrip from the Wizard spell list. You also learn two first level spells from the Wizard spell list and can cast each of them without requiring material components once, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest. The spells are written into your spellbook, and you can use your spellbook as an arcane focus. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.
When you gain a level in any class, you can replace one of the spells in your spellbook with another spell from the Wizard's spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Breath Weapon
entries: You gain a magical breath weapon that allows you to exhale powerful energy based on your Draconic Origin. As an action you can release this powerful energy in either a 30-foot long 5-foot wide line or a 30-foot cone (your choice). Each creature in its area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 damage of the same type you resist from your Draconic Origin.. When you reach higher levels in this class, your breath weapon's damage increases, becoming a 5d6 at 9th level, 6d6 at 13th level, 7d6 at 17th level, and 8d6 at 20th level. It's range also increases to 60 feet at 13th level and 90 feet at 20th level.
You can use this breath weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the {@spell Find Familiar} spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon has the 'Familiar' feature when summoned in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Ferocity
entries: If you move 20 ft towards a creature and make a melee weapon attack against that creature, you add an additional 1d6 damage of the weapon's type and they make a strength saving throw DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your strength or dexterity modifier. On a failed save, they are knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Shapechanger
entries: You learn the {@spell disguise self} and {@spell alter self} spells, and can cast each of them without requiring components once per short or long rest without spending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: You grow a pair of wings that allows you to fly. While you are wearing medium or light armor, or wearing no armor, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Moderate Draconic Senses
entries: You gain 10 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don't have it already. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Insight
entries: As an action you can make a Wisdom (Insight) check opposed against an opposing creature's Charisma (Deception) check. On a success, you can determine whether the creature is evil, good, or neutral and their creature type.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Draconic Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the {@spell Find Familiar} spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon or a Faerie Dragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon or Faerie Dragon has the 'Familiar' feature when summoned in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Fury
entries: You have a special action that you can use to unleash a powerful barrage of attacks. You make four melee weapon attacks, but you do not add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage rolls of the last two attacks. If you use an ability modifier for damage other than Strength or Dexterity, the same restriction applies. When you use this feature, you lose the ability to do so, but you roll a d6 at the start of each of your turns. On a 5-6 you regain the usage of this feature. You also regain the usage of this feature when you roll initiative.

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Draconic Senses
entries: You gain 30 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don't have it already. Magical darkness no longer impedes your darkvision. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft. If you already had blindsight, its range increases by 20 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Flight
entries: Your ability to fly has greatly improved since you started, and now you can rival the speed of most dragons. Your flying speed increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Artifact
entries: A magical artifact with draconic origins appears in your hand. Work with your DM on the specifics of the magical item, but the specific guidelines of the item goes as follows:

items: The item requires attunement, but does not count against your total attunement slots. Only you can attune to this item.
If the item is a weapon, it is a magical weapon with a +3 magic bonus to its attack and damage rolls.

It has one minor beneficial artifact property, one major beneficial artifact property, and one minor detrimental artifact property. You can roll these on their respective tables, or the DM can choose the properties of the item.
If it is an arcane focus, it grants a +2 to spell attack bonus and a +2 to spell save dc.
The item is riddled with draconic scales related to the Draconic Origins of its weidler.

optionalfeature.name: Additional Draconic Sigils
entries: You've discovered more advanced draconic magic, you've learned how to scribe the following sigils using your Draconic Sigils power:

entries.name: Sigil of Levity
entries: This magic sigil makes the object completely weightless to the creature attuned to it. To any other creature not attuned to it, it retains its normal weight. If a weapon is scribed with this sigil, its heavy property is replaced with the light property and you can ignore the two-handed property if it's a melee weapon. In addition, the first time on each of your turns that you make an attack using this weightless weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack roll. If you scribed a set of medium or heavy armor with this sigil, the maximum dexterity modifier you can add to your AC increases by 1 and you can ignore the strength requirements of said armor, if any and you no longer suffer disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when wearing said armor.

entries.name: Sigil of Celerity
entries: While wearing or carrying the object scribed with this sigil, when the attuned creature takes the dash action, they can move an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Sigil of Alacrity
entries: While wearing or carrying the object scribed with this sigil, the attuned creature adds a +1 bonus to their initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Magic
entries: You've trained with your ally to work in tandem using magic. Choose one cantrip and one 1st level spell that you know, your draconic ally can cast that cantrip at will and it can cast the 1st level spell once, regaining the ability to cast it again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Rider
entries: When you manifest your dragon, it comes equipped with an exoctic saddle. This saddle has holsters for up to two weapons and a large quiver that can hold up to 40 arrows. You can ride your manifested dragon regardless of size restraints, so long as you are not larger than your manifested dragon.

While you are mounted on a dragon, you can force an attack targeted at you to target the dragon instead. A dragon you are mounted on has advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than it.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Dragon
entries: If your manifested dragon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it can use its reaction and instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. A creature can only benefit from this feature if its speed is not 0 and if it is not incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Dragon's Sight
entries: Your manifested dragon's vision improves, resembling that of its dragon kind. Its darkvision is increased to a range of 120 feet and it has blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of The Drakes
entries: Your manifested dragon can use its magic to exhale a magical burst of energy. When it takes the attack action, it can replace one of its attacks with this burst of energy that targets one creature or object within 60 feet of it. If the target is a creature, it makes a Dexterity saving throw. The DC equals 8 + PB + 3. On a failed save, the target takes 2d10 damage of a type it chooses from the resistances or immunities it gains from its Shared Traits, or it takes half as much damage on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Trained Body
entries: You've trained your manifested dragon to endure the trials of combat. Your manifested dragon has resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Manifest Draconic Spirit
entries: You can cast {@spell Summon Draconic Spirit|FTD} as a 5th level spell without requiring material components using Charisma as your spellcasting ability.
Once you have cast the spell in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Persistent Allies
entries: Whenever your manifested dragon is within 30 feet of you they regain 5 hit points at the start of their turn as long as they have at least 1 hit point. In addition if they fail a saving throw while within 30 ft of you, they can spend their reaction to reroll that saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Manifest Stinger
entries: When you manifest your dragon, its tail grows a sharp stinger that holds a potent poison. It has a natural weapon in the form of a sting attack, which has the same bonus to hit as its bite and on hit deals the same damage as its bite, plus the creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + 3) or take 7d6 poison damage and is poisoned on a failed save, or half as much on a success and is not poisoned. It can only make one stinger attack per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Summons
entries: When you manifest your dragon, it gains 3 legendary resistances that it can use. See Legendary Resistance from an Adult Dragon for reference. These legendary resistances do not recharge per dawn, and you can only give a manifested dragon these legendary resistances once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Shadows
entries: As an action, you can assume a shadowy form by spending 2 invoke energy that grants you the powers of a shadow dragon for 1 minute. While in this shadowy form, you gain the following benefits:

items: While in dim light or darkness, you have resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.
You have advantage on (Dexterity) Stealth checks while in dim light or darkness.

You gain resistance to necrotic damage, and if you have a breath weapon or the Dragonfire Invocation (from a racial ability, feat, spell, or class feature) it can deal necrotic damage instead of its normal damage.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Recovery
entries: As an action you can spend invoke energy up to your proficiency bonus to touch a creature and heal them for 1d8 hit points per invoke energy spent. Alternatively, as an action you can spend 2 invoke energy to cure a poison or disease afflicting a creature you touch.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Spell Recovery
entries: During a short rest, you can spend hit dice to restore spent 1st level spell slots. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Invocation of Greater Spell Recovery
entries: During a short rest, you can spend hit dice to restore spent 2nd level spell slots. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

otherSummary.entry: Invoker Archetype, Invocation of Spell Recovery
otherSummary.entrySummary: Invoker Archetype, Invocation of Spell Recovery

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Invocation
entries: When you spend invoke energy to use one of your invocations, you gain a legendary resistance. See Legendary Resistance from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Old Magicks
entries: Magical runes appear on your body with spells stored inside of them. You learn one cantrip from the sorcerer spell list and any two 1st level spells from the sorcerer spell list. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell using this rune again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Runes
entries: You can share your powerful magical gifts with some of your allies. When you finish a long rest, choose a number of creatures equal to 2 plus your proficiency bonus. You can give each of them one of your runes that you chose at level 3. Each ally can only have one of these runes at any time, and if they are given another one of these runes, the other is lost.
If you use this feature again, any runes previously created by this feature vanish and their power is lost.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Spell Disruption
entries: A magical rune appears on your hand which contains the power to disrupt spells. You learn the {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic} spells. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell using this rune again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Greater Magicks
entries: You learn two additional spells from the sorcerer spell list. These spells follow the same rules as the ones from the Rune of Old Magicks, but can be of 1st to 3rd level spells.

otherSummary.entry: Runic Scribe, Rune of Old Magicks
otherSummary.entrySummary: Runic Scribe, Rune of Old Magicks

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Runes
entries: Your runic power fills you with old magic that you can use to further protect yourself from modern magic. Whenever you invoke the latent power of your runes, you gain a legendary resistance. See Legendary Resistance from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Form
entries: While in your Draconic Shape, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and Strength saving throws. In addition, you add an amount of damage to your natural weapons equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Shape
entries: When you use your Draconic Shape, you gain an additional 10  temporary hit points. In addition, you gain 3 Legendary Resistances when you change into your Draconic Shape. See 'Legendary Resistance' from an {@creature Adult Red Dragon|MM} for reference. You only gain these Legendary Resistances once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Tail
entries: Both in your humanoid shape and your Draconic Shape you have a powerful tail. This tail counts as a natural weapon and does 1d8 bludgeoning damage. It uses Your Strength or Dexterity modifier for its attack and damage rolls.

If you've taken the attack action, as a bonus action you can immediately make one tail attack, provided you have not already used your tail as part of your attack action. Instead of dealing damage, using this bonus action you can take the shove action using your tail. See page 195 of the Player's Handbook for information on the Shove Action.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: You have a magical telepathic power that can be summoned at any time. You know the {@spell message} cantrip and can cast it without using components. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Psionics
entries: You have a small pool of psionic power which you can call upon at any time. You know the {@spell Mind Sliver|TCE} cantrip. In addition you know the {@spell Dissonant Whispers} spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Psionics
entries: Your psionic powers have grown as you've slowly honed them. You learn the {@spell Tasha's Mind Whip|TCE} and {@spell Intellect Fortress|TCE} spells and can cast them without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. When you cast either spell in this manner, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast either of them using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

otherSummary.entry: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Psionics
otherSummary.entrySummary: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Psionics

optionalfeature.name: Improved Telepathy
entries: Your telepathic powers have improved, allowing you to reach your mind out further than you were able to previously. You learn the {@spell Sending} and {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond} spells and can cast them without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. When you cast either spell in this manner, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast either of them using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

otherSummary.entry: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Telepathy
otherSummary.entrySummary: any Gem Draconic Origin, Limited Telepathy

optionalfeature.name: Gem Growth
entries: As an action you can produce gems out of your body to form a weapon in moments of desperation. When you do so, you form a weapon with the statistics of a {@item dagger} and its properties. Instead of dealing piercing damage, it deals the damage associated with the damage you resist from your Draconic Origin. After you hit with the weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, the weapon is destroyed as the gems are imperfect and brittle. You can use this power a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Leap to the Skies
entries: Using the magical power TACSelling within you, you can empower your leaps even further! You learn the {@spell Jump} spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. The spell does not affect the distance you can jump using your lunging attack. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Dancing Whirlwind
entries: When you use your Lunging Attack while your Dance of Dragons is active, you can forgo your advantage along with any additional attacks you make as part of your attack action to instead make a single weapon attack that targets each creature within 5 feet of the space you land as part of your lunging attack. You use that attack roll to determine if it hits each creature. If it hits at least one of those creatures, you roll the damage as if you had hit one creature, half the total, and deal that damage to each creature that was hit.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Skydancer
entries: from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Arts
entries: You've honed your training with just your physical body, enhancing your ability to fight without a weapon. If you aren't wielding any weapons or a shield when you make the attack roll, your unarmed strikes are treated as natural weapons and have the finesse and light properties. In addition, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 plus your strength or dexterity modifier bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage instead of its normal amount.
As a bonus action you can enter either an offensive or defensive stance, when you do so apply one of the following effects depending on your stance:

entries.name: Offensive
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 damage instead of 1d6, however you suffer a -2 penalty to your AC.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 damage instead of 1d6, however you gain a +2 bonus to AC.

You retain these effects only when you are in the appropriate stance and you can exit or switch your stances as a bonus action on subsequent turns. You exit your stance early if you begin wielding a weapon or a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Ancestors
entries: You learn the {@spell Spirit Shroud|TCE} spell and can cast it once without requiring components, regaining the usage of it after a short or long rest. When you cast the spell using this feature, it deals the damage you resist from your Draconic Origin instead of its original damage options and the dead spirits are instead spirits of the dragons of your ancestry. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components and you follow the spell's normal guidelines.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Ancestry
entries: When you use your Mystical Strikes feature, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus and you gain a legendary resistance. See Legendary Resistance from an Adult Dragon for reference. You can only gain up to 3 legendary resistances per long rest, and you can only gain a legendary resistance once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Blessing
entries: Metallic dragons harness the divine powers of Bahamut, having origins from these dragons offers you the same blessing of divine magic. You learn the guidance cantrip and can cast it at will. In addition you learn cure wounds and one 1st level spell from the cleric or paladin spell lists. You can cast either spell without using material components, even costly ones. When you cast either of these spells, you cannot cast that spell until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Ally
entries: As an action, you can magically create a {@creature Metallic Warbler|FTD} and you are treated as its master. It is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It shares your initiative in combat, but takes its turn immediately after yours. It can act on its own or you can telepathically command it (no action required).
You can only have one metallic warbler at a time and you can create one a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deep Origins
entries: Your draconic origins stem beyond that of ordinary chromatic dragons. Instead, your powers come from a cousin of a chromatic dragon - the deep dragons, granting you the following properties:

items: {@b {@i Commanding Spores.}} As a bonus action, you can magically conjure intoxicating spores that affect the minds of creatures nearby. Choose a creature within 30 feet of you, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. On a failed save, the creature must make a melee weapon attack against a random creature or it instead takes 1d10 psychic damage if one is not within reach. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
{@b {@i Darkvision.}} You gain darkvision out to a range of 30 feet, or it is extended by 30 feet if you already had darkvision.
{@b {@i Deep Tongue.}} You can speak, read, and write Undercommon or one other language of your choice if you already have Undercommon.

optionalfeature.name: Aberrant Origins
entries: Your draconic origins draw deeper than from the powerful mythical beasts themselves. Mayhaps your kin are from the distant Far Realm, a horrid place of unspeakable creatures. As a result, your body becomes permanently altered, granting you new abilities as a result. Your creature type becomes your original creature type and aberration.You learn to speak, read, and write Deep Speech. If you already know Deep Speech, you can choose another exotic language instead.

In addition, as an action you can create a number of eldritch tentacles equal to your proficiency bonus for up to 1 minute, and you can dismiss them at any time (no action required). These tentacles can extend the reach of your melee weapons by 5 feet, provided you have at least one of them. A weapon with the two-handed or heavy properties requires at least two eldritch tentacles to gain this benefit. (Example: a longsword will have a reach of 10 feet whereas a weapon with the reach property, such as a glaive, would have a reach of 15 feet.)
Whenever you take damage, as a reaction you can sacrifice one of these eldritch tentacles to reduce the damage by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Horror
entries: Your eldritch powers become more potent as your experience grows. When you use your action to create your eldritch tentacles, you can force every creature within 30 feet of you that can see you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC: 8 + proficiency bonus + charisma modifier ) or be {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn. While frightened in this way, the creatures are also {@condition stunned}.

optionalfeature.name: Elder Abomination
entries: You have two uses of your Aberrant Origins feature instead of one. In addition, as an action you can use your eldritch tentacles to attempt to {@action grapple} as many creatures within 10 feet of you as you have eldritch tentacles. Creatures successfully {@condition grappled} by you are {@condition restrained}. If you do not have at least one of your eldritch tentacles free, you do not gain the reach improvement for your weapons.
A creature {@condition grappled} by your eldritch tentacles are restrained, and take psychic damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Slave
entries: Using your aberrant abilities, you can take over the mind of a defeated humanoid. As an action you can touch an unconscious humanoid with 0 hit points and infect them with a special tadpole that you magically produce. When you finish a long rest, the infected humanoid awakens with all of its hitpoints and treats you and your allies as friends. They obey all of your commands and are willing to fight for you.

A humanoid is immune to these effects if their CR or level is equal to or higher than yours, or if they are immune to being charmed or possessed. A remove curse, greater restoration, or heal spell can cure the infection before the long rest, but afterward only a Wish can restore the creature to its senses.
You can only have one humanoid infected with a tadpole at any given time. Any attempts to create another tadpole frees the previously infected creature from its tadpole, ending your control over it.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Dragon
entries: Your draconic ancestors stem from the reaches of the Twilit forests of the Feywild, granting you the properties of a Fey-like Dragon. You can speak, read, and write Sylvan. If you already know Sylvan, you can learn one other exotic language instead. In addition, whenever you complete a long rest you can choose to gain one of the following properties:

items: {@b Limited Magic Resistance.} When you are forced to make a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, you can use your reaction to gain advantage on that saving throw. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

{@b Limited Invisibility.} As a bonus action, you can choose to become {@condition invisible}. This invisibility lasts for 1 minute, or until you attack, cast a spell, or take any amount of damage. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

{@b Fey Magic.} You have an innate ability to call upon the magic of the feywild. You can cast the dancing lights cantrip at will. In addition, you learn two 1st level spells from the divination or illusion schools of magic and can cast each of them once without requiring material components or spending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries: You can only have one of these properties at any given time and if you choose a different property when you complete a long rest, you lose the previous property until you choose it again after you complete another long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Euphoria Breath
entries: Your breath becomes a puff of confusing and colorful gas, just like many creatures of the feywild. Your Draconic Breath Weapon becomes a Wisdom saving throw and a creature who fails, for 1 minute, can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:
14. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.
56. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is repeat its saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Song of The Moon Dragon
entries: When you use your Dragonsong draconic power, you can then choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. They must make an Intelligence saving throw ( DC = 8 + Proficiency Bonus + Charisma modifier) or be compelled to dance until the start of your next turn. While dancing, they are incapacitated and only they hear a merry waltz in their head.

optionalfeature.name: Song of Horrors
entries: When you use your Dragonsong draconic power, you can then choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. They must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + Proficiency Bonus + Charisma modifier) or become frightened of you while your dragonsong is active. They can repeat their saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Dance
entries: When you use your Dragonsong draconic power, you can choose to perform an elemental dance which grants you power. Once per turn, while performing this chromatic  dance, when you hit with a melee attack using an unarmed strike or a weapon, you can add an extra 1d4 bonus to the damage roll. This extra damage is the type associated with your Draconic Origin. You concentrate on this effect as if you were concentrating on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Dance
entries: When you use your Dragonsong draconic power, you can choose to perform a glorious dance which grants you power. You begin to shimmer and glow, granting you a stunning appearance. You have advantage on Charisma ability checks and Charisma saving throws while your Dragonsong is active. You concentrate on this effect as if you were concentrating on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Brilliant Dance of Gems
entries: When you use your Dragonsong draconic power, you can choose to perform a glistening dance which grants you power. Psionic energy veils you, protecting you against further harm. You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus. If you still have any of these temporary hit points when your Dragonsong ends, they are lost.

optionalfeature.name: Dream Breath
entries: Instead of exhaling a powerful breath weapon, you can expend a use of your Draconic Breath Weapon to instead cast the {@spell Banishment} spell, targeting a creature within range of your breath weapon. You use your breath weapon's DC for the DC of the spell. When the creature is banished in this way, they are sent to a harmless dream plane instead of the astral plane.

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Breath
entries: Your breath weapon gains a repulsive blast which can knock enemies back. Your Draconic Breath Weapon becomes a Strength saving throw instead and knocks creatures who fail the save back 15 feet.

otherSummary.entry: Bronze Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Bronze Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Sleepy Breath
entries: Your breath weapon becomes a steaming gas that knocks the vitality out of creatures. Your Draconic Breath Weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and creatures who fail fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

otherSummary.entry: Brass Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Brass Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Freezing Breath
entries: Your breath becomes a cold gas that freezes creatures solid temporarily. Your Draconic Breath Weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and creatures who fail become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

otherSummary.entry: Silver Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Silver Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Weakening Breath
entries: Your breath can sunder powerful creatures useless with a stupefying gas. Your breath weapon becomes a Strength saving throw and creatures who fail have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

otherSummary.entry: Gold Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Gold Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Slowing Breath
entries: Your breath can release an acidic gas which can slow an enemy's movements. Your Draconic Breath weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and creatures who fail can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. These effects last for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.

otherSummary.entry: Copper Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Copper Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Nightmare Breath
entries: Your breath sews nightmarish horrors into the minds of creatures. Your Draconic Breath Weapon becomes a Wisdom saving throw instead and creatures who fail are {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.

otherSummary.entry: Aberrant or Deep Origins, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Aberrant or Deep Origins, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Singularity Breath
entries: Your breath becomes empowered by gravitational forces. Your Draconic Breath weapon becomes a Strength saving throw instead and creatures who fail have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

otherSummary.entry: Amethyst Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Amethyst Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Spatial Duplicate
entries: As an action you can create an illusory duplicate of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of you for up to 1 minute. You concentrate on this ability as if you were concentrating on a spell and the duplicate vanishes when your concentration is broken or when you dismiss it (no action required). The duplicate mirrors your appearance and echos you when you speak. During the action you summon it, and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can move the duplicate 30 feet in any direction you choose or swap places with the duplicate.

As a reaction whenever you would take damage, you can swap places with the duplicate taking half of the damage you would have originally taken. You still suffer from spells or effects that affect an area, even if you would end up in an area outside of the effect. You cannot use this reaction if the source of the damage affects both you and the duplicate.
You can use this feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Debilitating Breath
entries: Your breath becomes a booming force of thunderous power. Your Draconic Breath weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and creatures who fail are incapacitated until the start of your next turn.

otherSummary.entry: Sapphire Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Sapphire Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Awesome Thunder
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and unleash a thunderous battle cry. As you do, loud sound waves surround the target. They must make a Constitution saving throw, DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier, and they take 2d6 thunder damage and are stunned on a failed save or half as much damage and are not stunned on a success.
You can use this feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Breath
entries: Your breath becomes filled with confusing psionic energy. Your Draconic Breath weapon becomes an Intelligence saving throw instead and creatures who fail have subtract a d6 whenever they make an ability check, attack roll, or a saving throw until the start of your next turn.

otherSummary.entry: Emerald Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Emerald Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Perceptions
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and attempt to alter their perception. They must make an Intelligence saving throw, DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier, and they take {@damage 2d10} psychic damage and have disadvantage on saving throws until the start of your next turn on a failed save.
You can use this feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Scintillating Breath
entries: Your breath becomes instilled with starlight energy, giving you a portion of energy from affected creatures. Your Draconic Breath weapon becomes a Constitution saving throw instead and as long as one or more creatures take damage, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level plus your proficiency bonus.

otherSummary.entry: Crystal Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon
otherSummary.entrySummary: Crystal Draconic Origin, Draconic Breath Weapon

optionalfeature.name: Starlight Strike
entries: As a bonus action you can empower a weapon or your unarmed strikes with magical starlight for 1 minute.
