For the duration, attacks made with the weapon or unarmed strike deals radiant damage instead of its original damage type and they shed bright light for 5 feet and dim light for an additional 5 feet. Also, the first time you hit with the starlight empowered weapon or unarmed strike on each of your turns, it deals an additional 1d4 radiant damage.
You can empower your weapons or unarmed strikes with starlight twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Negative Energy Infusion
entries: As a bonus action, you can infuse a weapon or your unarmed strikes with negative energy for 1 minute. For the duration, attacks made with the weapon or unarmed strike deals necrotic damage instead and creatures you hit with them cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Wyvern
entries: As a bonus action, you can soak your weapons in a special potent poison. For the next minute, the next time you hit with an attack made with a weapon, the creature needs to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + Proficiency Bonus + Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute, or half as much on a success and is not poisoned. The damage of this power increases as you gain levels in this class, becoming 1d8 at 6th level, 1d10 at 10th level, and 1d12 at 14th level.
You can use this draconic power twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Alchemy
entries: Your draconic blood allows you to infuse your own blood into magical potions that you and your allies can gain benefits from. You gain proficiency with alchemist supplies. With your current experience, you can only empower certain potions you have in your possession. During a short rest, or with one hour of work and by spending 1 hit die, you can have the following potions gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Potion of Healing (all varieties)
entries: Each die used for healing becomes a d6.

entries.name: Potion of Resistance (Only the damage type you resist from your Draconic Origin)
entries: In addition to gaining resistance to the damage type, the drinker reduces all damage they take from that type by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Potion of Growth
entries: The d4 extra damage increases to a d6.

entries.name: Potion of Giant Strength (all varieties)
entries: The strength score listed becomes 1 point higher. Example, a Potion of Hill Giant strength becomes 22 instead of 21.

entries.name: Potion of Fire Breath
entries: The damage the breath does becomes the damage you resist from your Draconic Origin. In addition, the DC is increased by your proficiency bonus and does one extra d6 of damage.

optionalfeature.name: Intermediate Draconic Alchemy
entries: During a short rest, or with one hour of work, you can spend a hit die and touch a vial, potion, or similarly sized container. You fill the container with your blood which then magically changes into one of the following potions, which are then empowered similarly to your Draconic Alchemy powers:

items: Potion of Healing
Potion of Growth
Potion of Fire Breath

entries: Potions created using this power lasts for 24 hours, after which the liquid inside of the potion disappears in a puff of smoke.
In addition, using the same method, you may empower the following potions with the following benefits:

entries.name: Potion of Heroism
entries: The temporary hit points received increases by an amount equal to your dragon warrior level.

entries.name: Potion of Mind Reading
entries: The DC of the effect is increased by your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Potion of Dimmunation
entries: You no longer have disadvantage on strength ability checks or saving throws, nor do you receive a damage reduction for being smaller.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Draconic Alchemy
entries: During a short rest, or with one hour of work, you can spend a hit die and touch a vial, potion, or similarly sized container. You fill the container with your blood which then magically changes into one of the following potions, which are then empowered similarly to your Draconic Alchemy powers:

items: Potion of Greater Healing
Potion of Hill Giant Strength
Potion of Resistance (you can only choose the resistance you gain from your Draconic Origin)

entries: Potions created using this power lasts for 24 hours, after which the liquid inside of the potion disappears in a puff of smoke.
In addition, using the same method, you may empower the following potions with the following benefits:

entries.name: Potion of Flying
entries: The flying speed given is now double your walking speed instead of equal.

entries.name: Potion of Vitality
entries: When consumed, the potion gives the affected creature's hit point maximum is increased by your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Mastered Draconic Alchemy
entries: During a short rest, or with one hour of work, you can spend a hit die and touch a vial, potion, or similarly sized container. You fill the container with your blood which then magically changes into one of the following potions, which are then empowered similarly to your Draconic Alchemy powers:

items: Potion of Superior Healing
Potion of Stone Giant Strength
Potion of Heroism
Potion of Dimmunation

entries: Potions created using this power lasts for 24 hours, after which the liquid inside of the potion disappears in a puff of smoke.

otherSummary.entry: Draconic Alchemy, Intermediate Draconic Alchemy, Advanced Draconic Alchemy
otherSummary.entrySummary: Draconic Alchemy, Intermediate Draconic Alchemy, Advanced Draconic Alchemy

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Draconic Alchemy
entries: During a short rest, or with one hour of work, you can spend a hit die and touch a vial, potion, or similarly sized container. You fill the container with your blood which then magically changes into one of the following potions, which are then empowered similarly to your Draconic Alchemy powers:

items: Potion of Supreme Healing
Potion of Flying
Potion of Fire Giant Strength
Potion of Vitality
Potion of Dragon's Majesty (The dragon the drinker becomes is related to your Draconic Origin)

entries: Potions created using this power lasts for 24 hours, after which the liquid inside of the potion disappears in a puff of smoke.

otherSummary.entry: Draconic Alchemy, Intermediate Draconic Alchemy, Advanced Draconic Alchemy, Mastered Draconic Alchemy
otherSummary.entrySummary: Draconic Alchemy, Intermediate Draconic Alchemy, Advanced Draconic Alchemy, Mastered Draconic Alchemy

optionalfeature.name: Ancestor
entries: Your magic is granted to you by a mysterious ancestor. Perhaps this was a powerful mage, a creature with unique control over fate, or an angel of a god of fate. You don't know the exact nature of this ancestor, but you know enough to seek answers. Choosing this mystery grants you the following benefits:

items: You learn how to speak, read, and write one language of your choice. This language can be a secret language, at the discretion between you and the DM.
You gain proficiency with one weapon, skill, or tool of your choice.
When a creature benefits from your fate weaving feature, they can record the number rolled on the fate die and use that bonus on their next ability check that uses a skill or tool.

items.name: Mystery Spells
entries: You always have the {@spell comprehend languages} spell prepared, and it doesn't count against your total number of spells you have prepared. You prepare more spells in this way when you reach higher levels in this class, preparing {@spell borrowed knowledge|SCC} at 3rd level, {@spell tongues} at 5th level, {@spell locate creature} at 7th level, and {@spell skill empowerment|XGE} at 9th.

optionalfeature.name: Nature
entries: Your magic is granted to you by nature itself, through a god or an innate connection to it, or perhaps an Archfey has blessed you with magic. You don't know why you have this unique connection to nature, but you have an understanding that there is a greater reason why you have this innate power. Choosing this mystery grants you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with Survival and with Herbalism Kits. In addition, animals have a basic understanding of what you say when you speak to them, and you can understand their emotions and basic thoughts, though you cannot fully speak with them without the aid of a spell or other similar magic.
When a creature benefits from your fate weaving feature and is missing any hit points, they can regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled on the fate die.

items.name: Mystery Spells
entries: You always have the {@spell animal friendship} spell prepared, and it doesn't count against your total number of spells you have prepared. You prepare more spells in this way when you reach higher levels in this class, preparing {@spell barkskin} at 3rd level, {@spell plant growth} at 5th level, {@spell guardian of nature|XGE} at 7th level, and {@spell awaken} at 9th.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial
entries: Your magic is divine and granted to you by a divine creature. Examples are Ki-rins, angels, a deity, etc. You've always had a unique attraction to celestial beings, their lore and power of the various domains of the multiverse intrigues you greatly. You are unsure of the specifics which draws your attention to celestials, but you know enough to continue your search for these angelic beings.

items: You can speak, read, and write Celestial and you gain proficiency with Religion.
When a creature benefits from your fate weaving, they can choose a creature within 60 feet of them to deal radiant damage to that creature equal to the number rolled on the fate die.

items.name: Mystery Spells
entries: You always have the {@spell guiding bolt} spell prepared, and it doesn't count against your total number of spells you have prepared. You prepare more spells in this way when you reach higher levels in this class, preparing {@spell moonbeam} at 3rd level, {@spell crusader's mantle} at 5th level, {@spell guardian of faith} at 7th level, and {@spell holy weapon|XGE} at 9th.

optionalfeature.name: Ancient Lore
entries: Your magic stems from old, maybe even forgotten magic. This magic can stem from powerful creatures, a forgotten society, or even a powerful artifact. This mystery is one you've been researching all your life and have made very little progress on, as this lore is mostly forgotten to the masses.

items: You can speak, read, and write one of the following languages: Celestial, Draconic, Giant, Primordial, Sylvan, or another language that you and the DM agree upon. In addition, you gain proficiency with Arcana.

When a creature benefits from your fate weaving, your magic grows stronger. The damage or healing of the next spell you cast gains a bonus to one of the rolls equal to the number rolled on the fate die.

items.name: Mystery Spells
entries: You always have the {@spell ode of seasons|TACS} spell prepared, and it doesn't count against your total number of spells you have prepared. You prepare more spells in this way when you reach higher levels in this class, preparing {@spell reveal/conceal|TACS} at 3rd level, {@spell charity|TACS} at 5th level, {@spell ward of vitality|TACS} at 7th level, and {@spell circle of power} at 9th.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Seer
entries: You are blind, and can only see to a limited range using your ability of foresight. For the purposes of this, you have blindsight out to a range of 30 feet, but are blind past that point. When you cast a spell or use a fate weaver feature that has a further range than your blindsight, you can make a Wisdom (Perception) check to channel your inner foresight and predict where the target or point of the spell will be, even if the spell requires sight.

The DC is equal to 10 plus the spell's level, or against the intended target's Dexterity (Stealth) check, whichever is higher. If the spell requires sight, increase the DC by 5. If you fail, the DM can determine a random target that qualifies for the spell that is outside of the range of your blindsight and within the range of your spell.
As a reminder, blindsight qualifies for anything in the D&D rules that requires you to see something, provided that thing is within your blindsight's radius.

optionalfeature.name: Boon of the Blinded
entries: When you gain your Cursed Awakening feature, the range of your blindsight extends out to a range of 60 feet. In addition, you can use an action to treat your blindsight as truesight for 1 hour, though you are still blind past the new range of your blindsight. You can enhance your blindsight in this way once, regaining the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Haunted
entries: A malevolent spirit haunts your mind constantly, making you paranoid at every turn. The nature of this spirit attempts to halt your progress on trying to discover more about your chosen mystery. This spirit is connected to your soul, and can be seen by creatures under the effects of {@spell detect evil and good spell} or similar magic. You have disadvantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} condition and cannot benefit from gaining advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} nor can you be immune to being {@condition frightened}.

The spirit remains as long as the curse remains, but vanishes temporarily if the curse is suppressed. A {@spell dispel evil and good spell} can also cause the spirit to vanish for one hour, negating the curse temporarily until it returns.

optionalfeature.name: Boon of the Haunted
entries: When you gain your Cursed Awakening feature, you no longer have disadvantage on saving throws made to resist being {@condition frightened}, but you still cannot gain advantage nor be immune to being {@condition frightened}. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks and when a creature fails a saving throw against one of your fate weaver spells, they become frightened for 1 minute, or until the spell ends, whichever ends last.

optionalfeature.name: Blackened
entries: Parts of your body are shriveled and blackened, as if you had been plunged into a blazing fire, and your thin, papery skin is sensitive to the touch. When you take fire damage you take an extra amount of damage equal to your proficiency bonus and you cannot gain resistance or immunity to fire damage. If it was granted by your race, you lose that resistance or immunity. You learn the {@spell firebolt} cantrip and it doesn't count against your total number of fate weaver cantrips.

optionalfeature.name: Boon of the Blackened
entries: When you gain your Cursed Awakening feature, you always have the {@spell burning hands} and {@spell burning touch|TACS} spells prepared and can cast them at their lowest levels without expending a spell slot each once without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Forgotten
entries: People find it difficult to remember who you are, their memories of you often clouded and inconsistent. Outside of creatures that travel with you, you are easily forgotten by other creatures that have only briefly seen you. These creatures have a -10 penalty on Intelligence checks made to remember who you are, including your own family and friends, provided they are not currently traveling with you. They have to make a check each time they interact with you, or every 24 hours you have not interacted with them until they fail, at which point they forget who you are.

optionalfeature.name: Boon of the Forgotten
entries: When you gain your Cursed Awakening feature, you can use a bonus action to make a creature that you can see forget who you are completely and even forget you were standing right there in front of them, turning {@condition invisible} for that creature for the next minute. Each time you cast a spell or attack them with a weapon, they can make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, ending your invisibility on a success. You can use this feature once, regaining the ability to use it again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Armor
entries: You can magically create a set of armor made up of your own blood infused with magic. You can cast {@spell Mage Armor} at will. When you do so, roll a hemomancy die and take damage equal to what you roll.

optionalfeature.name: Amorphous Transformation
entries: You can magically morph yourself into a blob of blood which can pass through narrow spaces. As an action by spending a hemomancy die, you can assume your amorphous transformation, which lasts for 1 minute. While in this form, you have the amorphous trait, which allows you to pass through spaces as narrow as 1 inch.

You still retain the ability to use your other features, abilities, and weapons in this form - however any damage you deal, whether it be from a spell or weapon, will instead deal necrotic damage. You can use this Blood Talent once, regaining the ability to do so again after a long rest, or you can spend a hit die during a short rest to regain the use of this Blood Talent.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Hex
entries: You can place a magical enchantment on a creature using your blood magic. You can cast the {@spell Hex} spell once without requiring material components, regaining the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest. Alternatively, you can spend a hemomancy die to regain the use of this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Tendrils
entries: You can magically conjure tendrils made of your own blood and quickly lash out at your enemies. You can cast {@spell Arms of Hadar} by spending a hemomancy die.

optionalfeature.name: Slick Blood
entries: You can conjure a puddle of blood underneath your enemies' feet, causing them to slip and tumble. You can cast {@spell Grease} by spending a hemomancy die without requiring material components.

optionalfeature.name: Prophetic Demise
entries: You can attempt to incite your will onto fate and control the destiny of your foes. You can cast {@spell bane} by spending a hemomancy die.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Infusion
entries: You can magically enchant your weapons using your blood magic. You can cast Magic Weapon by spending two hemomancy dice.

optionalfeature.name: Bleeding Ray of Pain
entries: You can summon an arcane power which can sunder your foes. You can cast {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement} by spending two hemancy dice.

optionalfeature.name: Masking Blood
entries: You can manifest a masking layer of blood to hide your true self. You can spend a hemomancy die to cast {@spell Disguise Self}.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Blood Servant
entries: Using your occultic magic, you can bring back the enemies you've slain. You can cast {@spell Animate Dead} without requiring material components by spending 3 hemomancy dice. You can use this talent once, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spiteful Curse
entries: What sort of blood magic user comes without their own fair share of curses? You can spend 3 hemomancy dice to cast {@spell Bestow Curse}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Rage
entries: You can fill the mind of a nearby creature with hate and rage to send them off into a blood lust. You can cast {@spell Enemies Abound|XGE} by spending 3 hemomancy dice.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Mist
entries: By borrowing a few tricks from the mighty vampires, you can turn into a magical mist to make a tricky escape. You can cast {@spell Gaseous Form} without requiring material components by spending 3 hemomancy dice.

optionalfeature.name: Vitality Transfer
entries: Sometimes, you just feel like donating your kidneys or something I guess. You can spend 3 hemomancy dice to cast {@spell Life Transference|XGE}. When you do so, the amount of damage you took from your hemomancy dice is added to the healing of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of the Wretched
entries: You can imbue yourself with the power of life sucking undead. You can spend 3 hemomancy dice to cast {@spell Vampiric Touch}. You can use this Blood Talent once, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Veil of the Occult
entries: Sometimes you need to stay hidden, at all costs, including by pesky divination magic. You can spend 4 hemomancy dice to cast {@spell Nondetection} without requiring material components. You can use this Blood Talent once, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Quiet as a Whisper
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell pass without trace} spell without requiring material components, as unseelie magic veils you and your allies. Alternatively, you can use an action to cast the {@spell silence} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Disguise
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell disguise self} spell. When you use this fey trick, you can cast the spell an additional three times before you need to expend another use of your fey tricks. This resets after you complete a long rest, requiring you to spend a fey trick for the first use as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Feral Speech
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell speak with animals} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Go to Sleep!
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell sleep} spell as a 2nd level spell requiring no material components.

optionalfeature.name: Misfortune
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you and cause them to suffer a grave amount of misfortune. They must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, for the next minute they are cursed with misfortune. Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw during this time, they must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw. A {@spell remove curse} can end this effect early.

optionalfeature.name: Soothsayer's Warmth
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and instill them with healing energy of the seelie court. Roll your sneak attack dice, the target regains hit points equal to the result.

optionalfeature.name: Fairy Lights
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Trickster
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell fairy fun|TACS} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Deathcaller
entries: As an action, you can create an aura of death using unseelie magic for 1 minute. The aura extends out to a range of 10 feet. Each creature you choose that starts its turn within the aura cannot gain the benefits of healing.

optionalfeature.name: Cursed Wound
entries: When you hit with an attack roll and apply your sneak attack, you can also use this Fey Trick. Upon use, and for the next minute, whenever that creature would receive healing from any source, it instead takes damage equal to the amount it would have healed. A {@spell remove curse} can end this effect early.

optionalfeature.name: Discord
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell enemies abound|XGE} spell. A {@spell remove curse} can end the effects early.

optionalfeature.name: Fairy Flight
entries: As a bonus action, you can cast the {@spell fly} spell without requiring material components, but you can only target yourself. Alternatively, as an action you can cast the {@spell levitate} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Animal Shape
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell polymorph} spell without requiring material components. You can only use this fey trick once, regaining the ability to use it again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Form
entries: As a bonus action, you can cast the {@spell Fey Transformation|TACS} spell without requiring material components. You can only use this fey trick once, regaining the ability to use it again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Friendly Fey
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell summon fey} as a 4th level spell spell without requiring material components. You can only use this fey trick once, regaining the ability to use it again when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Escape
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell dimension door} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Now you See Me, and Now you See... Me!
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell mislead} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see chapter 5 for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Moreover, when you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of The Vial
entries: Your patron grants you a small glass vial, droplets of your blood and the essence of your patron are mixed within it. This magical vial has many magical properties and serves like an Arcane Focus. You can use your action to summon the vial into an empty hand. The vial disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the vial (no action required), or if you die.

When you form this magical vial, choose either your spell attack or spell save DC. You gain a +1 bonus to whichever benefit you chose when you use the vial as an arcane focus. You can change this benefit by performing a 10 minute ritual during a long rest and the new benefit takes effect once you complete the long rest.

In addition, choose one of the warlock spells that you know that is of a level no higher than half of your proficiency bonus (rounded up). You can store that spell into your Vial and cast it at its lowest level without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. The spell you store in the vial cannot require any costly materials. Every time you cast the spell, you take 1d8 points of damage per level of the spell as you spend your own vitality to cast the spell. When you cast the spell, the vial momentarily fills with your own blood and empties again after the spell is cast, leaving only the droplets of blood from when the blood pact was made.
You can cast the spell within the vial a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Life Draining Blast
entries: When you hit at least one creature with {@spell eldritch blast} on your turn, you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to one of the damage rolls. You can gain this benefit once a round.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Vial
entries: The benefit you receive to either your spell attack or spell save DC now applies to both when you use the vial as an arcane focus.
In addition, you can choose one cantrip from the Warlock spell list and store it within the vial, allowing you to cast that cantrip whenever you use the vial as an arcane focus.

optionalfeature.name: Scorching Blood
entries: While you have your pact vial out, you can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke|PHB} as a 3rd level spell without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Blast
entries: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with {@spell eldritch blast} on your turn, that creature cannot gain the benefits of healing until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Life Giver
entries: You can cast {@spell Life Transference|XGE} without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

In addition, you can cast {@spell Raise Dead|PHB} once without requiring material components or spending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest. When you cast the spell in this way, you are reduced to one hit point and you gain one level of exhaustion.

optionalfeature.name: Merciful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cause the damage to be treated as non-lethal, meaning that if the damage from the spell would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, it does not outright kill them, nor does it cause them to automatically fail a death saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Echoed Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage or restores hit points and you've already cast that spell within the last minute, you can cause the spell to increase in potency. You can spend 1 sorcery point for every time the spell was cast within the last minute (to a maximum of 5 sorcery points) and increase the damage or healing for one of the rolls of that spell by one die for every sorcery point spent.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that can target more than one creature or affects an area, you can spend 2 sorcery points to cause the spell to only affect one appropriate target instead. That creature has disadvantage on its saving throw, if any, and spell attack rolls from the spell against that target have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Haug Rune
entries: This rune's magic bestows a resilience reminiscent of a hill giant. As a bonus action, you can bestow the wielder of this weapon resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks

In addition, when you hit a creature with an attack made with this weapon, once a round you can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, they are knocked prone or pushed back 5 feet (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Ild Rune
entries: This rune's magic gives you the fiery powers of ancient giants. As a bonus action, you can ignite the flames on this weapon changing its properties. When you damage a target with an attack made with this weapon, you can change the damage type of the weapon to fire damage.

In addition, while the rune is active, magical flames veil your body. When you are hit with a melee attack, you can spend your reaction to deal {@dice 2d6} fire damage to the attacker as the flames lash out at the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Ise Rune
entries: This rune's magic evokes a frost giant's stoic calm. As a bonus action, you can evoke a cold energy onto this weapon changing its properties. When you damage a target with an attack made with this weapon, you can change the damage type of the weapon to cold damage.

In addition, while the rune is active provided you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) as magical ice forms around your body as a protective shell.

optionalfeature.name: Versel Rune
entries: This rune's magic contains the powerful might of dragons. As a bonus action, you can evoke this magic and empower yourself with it. You have advantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength ability checks, and Strength saving throws.
In addition, your movement speed is increased by 10 feet and moving out of a creature's reach does not provoke opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Ancient Horrors Rune
entries: This rune's magic contains the ancient horrors of aberrant creatures. As a bonus action you can release this rune's magic changing your weapon's properties. When you damage a creature with this weapon, you can force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, they become {@condition frightened} of you for one minute. They can repeat their save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

In addition, while this rune is active when you are hit by a melee attack by a creature, you can spend your reaction to release a tendril from the far realm to grab onto the attacker. They become {@condition grappled} for 1 minute. They can use an action to attempt to escape the grapple with an escape DC equal to your spell save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Uvar Rune
entries: Using this rune's magic, you can evoke the power of storms. As a bonus action, you can change the properties of your weapon using this rune's magic. When you damage a target with an attack made with this weapon, you can change the damage type of the weapon to lightning damage.

In addition, while this rune is active when you would be hit by a melee attack by a creature, you can spend your reaction and roll a {@dice d6}. You can reduce the attack roll by the number rolled on the {@dice d6}, potentially turning a hit into a miss.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

optionalfeature.name: Crane Style
entries: Your martial techniques blend poise with graceful defense. The crane style focuses on defensive stances and agile counterattacks. Monks of this style focus on using graceful, one-legged stances and folding arm techniques that mimic a crane's enormous wings.

When you take the dodge action, you gain a +2 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn. In addition, as a reaction when a creature misses you with a melee attack while within 5ft of you, you can immediately use your reaction to make a melee attack against that creature using an unarmed strike or monk weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Style
entries: The dragon style incorporates a wide variety of kicks, sweeps and rapid strikes which rely on a mix between raw strength and great agility. Monks of this style are known to shape their hands to mimic dragon claws.

When you are not wielding any weapons or only wielding monk weapons, you gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls. In addition, when you hit a creature with a monk weapon or unarmed strike, you can choose to push that creature 5 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Monkey Style
entries: Your unarmed fighting style is nimble and unpredictable, full of ground rolls and short leaps.

When you make a long or high jump, you can jump an additional number of feet equal to your Wisdom modifier. You can use your Dexterity score in place of your Strength score when determining how high or how far you can jump. When making a Strength (Athletics) check to climb, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the roll (to a minimum bonus of +1).
In addition, if you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can use a bonus action to take the disengage action.

optionalfeature.name: Snake Style
entries: Snake style emphasizes quick, shifting movements. Monks of this style normally hold their hands flat with the fingers together to mimic the head of a snake. Able to strike when least expected, snake stylists are known for opportunism and blinding speed.

You have advantage on opportunity attacks made with unarmed strikes and monk weapons. In addition, when a creature enters your melee range for the first time, you can use a reaction to make a melee attack against them using an unarmed strike or monk weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Tiger Style
entries: This style seeks to emulate the power and fury of the great tiger. Monks of this style use their hands like claws, perfecting overpowering double hand strikes and driving attack chains.
When you are not wielding any weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls. In addition, as a bonus action you can move up to half your movement toward an enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Wolf Style
entries: This style seeks to emulate the tenacity and savagery of the vicious wolf. It focuses on tripping or penalizing an opponent's movement.

When you hit a creature with a monk weapon or unarmed strike, you can attempt to shove or grapple that creature. When you do, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (to a minimum bonus of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Breathtaking Dance
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell suffocating sphere|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind Ballet
entries: You can spend 4 ki to cast {@spell cyclone|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Waterfall of the Elders
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell whelm|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Step of Giants
entries: You can spend 2 ki to cast {@spell thunderstomp|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Slapping Waves
entries: You can spend 2 ki to cast {@spell water whack|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Rolling Stone
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell boulder bash|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Waves
entries: You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell slipstream|TACS}.

optionalfeature.name: Direct the Thunderstorm
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell lightning bolt}.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of Fiery Dragons
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell fire storm}.

feat.name: Elemental Initiate
entries: You've been exposed to and have trained with the power of the elements and can use your ki to channel said elements. See {@i Casting Elemental Spells} from the Way of Four Elements Monk subclass for more information.

You have two ki points, of which you can only use to fuel your elemental disciplines. You regain these ki points when you finish a long rest. You learn two {@filter Elemental Disciplines|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=ED} from the Way of Four Elements Monk subclass.

When you level up you can exchange one of the disciplines chosen by this feat for another one. If a discipline has a level requirement, you must be a Way of Four Elements Monk of that level in order to choose it.

feat.name: Style Master
entries: You've been trained in a particular martial art, enhancing your ability to defend yourself in melee combat. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your unarmed strike uses a d4 for damage. You can use Dexterity in place of Strength for the attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes or simple weapons.
Choose one Martial Style option of your choice from the monk class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's martial style with another one from the monk class that you don't have.

feat.name: Empowered Elementalist
entries: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
When you cast a spell that deals damage of the chosen type, one of the damage rolls gains a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus. You can apply this bonus only once a turn.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

feat.name: Primordial Touched
entries: Your exposure to elemental energies has permanently changed you, allowing you to draw power from it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell absorb elements|XGE} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=C;V} must be from the conjuration or evocation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. When you cast absorb elements in this way, you can cast it as a 2nd level spell. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Rune Marked
entries: You've been blessed with ancient magic that's long been forgotten, it's power transforms you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell warding bond} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=A;V} must be from the abjuration or evocation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot, and you can cast {@spell warding bond} without requiring material components. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Hemomatic Adept
entries: You have studied occult based magic, leading you down a darker path. You have two hemomancy dice which are d6s, you regain spent hemomancy dice when you finish a long rest. These special dice fuel your hemomancy abilities. Whenever you use a hemomancy die, regardless if it is spent or not, you take damage equal to the number rolled. If you have hemomancy dice from another feature, these dice are tracked separately and do not scale with them.
You can use these Hemomancy dice in the following ways and if you have the Hemomancy feature provided from another source, these abilities are added to that feature:

items: {@b Blood-Boosted Ability.} Whenever you make an ability check with a skill or tool of which you are proficient in, you can use a hemomancy die and add the number rolled to the d20. You spend the hemomancy die only if the check is successful.

{@b Blood Fueled Rebuttal.} Whenever you take damage from a creature within 30 ft of you, you can spend a hemomancy die to deal necrotic damage to that creature equal to the number rolled plus your constitution modifier.

feat.name: Blood Marked
entries: Studying the arcane arts of blood magic, you've learned to use certain magical abilities and are marked with magical sigils, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell inflict wounds} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;N} must be from the enchnatment or necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Healer's Initiate
entries: You've become an expert at healing with magic, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell cure wounds} or {@spell healing word} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=A} must be from the abjuration school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Gift of the Celestials
entries: You've manifested some of the power of celestial creatures, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Healing Touch
entries: As an action, you touch another creature, they magically regain 1d10 plus your proficiency bonus hit points and are freed from any one poison or disease (your choice). You can use this healing touch once, regaining the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Protective Aura
entries: When you or a creature within 5 feet of you is forced to make a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, as a reaction you can choose to have the chosen target to gain advantage on that saving throw. You can make this choice before or after the roll, but before any effects are declared. You can grant this benefit once, regaining the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Gift of the Giants
entries: You've manifested some of the power of giants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Might of The Ancients
entries: If you would fail an ability check or saving throw using Strength, you can use a reaction to turn that failure into a success. You can use this reaction once, regaining the ability to do so again when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Ancient Knowledge
entries: You can perform a 1-hour ritual to seek guidance from ancient spirits using the runes on your body to call them. You can ask one question to an ancient spirit. The DM randomly determines whether the spirit knows the answer to your question, the more obscure the question the more likely they won't know the answer. If they know the answer, they must give a truthful response, which can be in the form of a cryptic answer or a clever rhyme. Once you perform this ritual, you cannot perform it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Brewer's Delight
entries: You're an expert at brewing nice and refreshing drinks for your allies, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item brewer's supplies|phb} if you don't already have it.

With one hour of work or when you finish a short or long rest, you can brew a number of beverages equal to your proficiency bonus, provided you have ingredients worth at least 5 gp per beverage made and brewer's supplies on hand. The healing properties of these beverages last 24 hours after being made. A creature can use a bonus action to drink one of those beverages to regain {@dice 1d4} plus your proficiency bonus hit points.

feat.name: Draconic Adept
entries: Studying occult lore, you learn one {@filter Draconic Power|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Draconic Power} option of your choice from the dragon warrior class. Your spellcasting ability for the power, if any, is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat). If the power has a prerequisite, you can choose that power only if you're a dragon warrior who meets the prerequisite.
Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the draconic power with another one from the dragon warrior class.

feat.name: Escape Artist
entries: You have practiced the art of nimbly escaping out of bindings and avoiding incoming attacks when attempting to run away from a group of enemies.

items: You have advantage on ability checks made to avoid or escape being grappled or restrained. In addition when you make an ability check to escape bindings or restraints, such as manacles or rope, you add a +5 bonus to the check.
When you take the dash action, opportunity attacks made against you have disadvantage on you.

feat.name: Draconic Herald
entries: Continuing your study of dragons, you've learned about all kinds of powerful wyrms and why they are so feared. Choose one additional {@filter Draconic Power|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Draconic Power} option from the dragon warrior class.

In addition to this power, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks made to influence dragons. This could be interpreted as inducing fear, trying to persuade a dragon to spare you or your companions, or even seek aid from a dragon.

feat.name: Light Armor Master
entries: You are an expert with light armor and are used to wearing it as slightly heavier clothing. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you are wearing light armor, you have an additional +1 bonus to your AC.

feat.name: Agile Maneuvers
entries: You've honed your speed and skill to focus more on technique than brute strength when knocking down or grabbing on to foes. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you attempt to grapple or shove a creature, you can use Strength or Dexterity for the Athletics check.

feat.name: Heroic Sacrifice
entries: When an ally is in danger, you are quick to step in and protect them. You gain the following benefits:

items: If a creature that is within the distance remaining in your movement as of the end of your last turn would be hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to move up to them and switch places with that creature, becoming the new target of the attack and every attack thereafter, provided you do not fall unconscious. If any of the attacks would hit, you treat each of them as a critical hit.

If a creature that is within the distance remaining in your movement as of the end of your last turn would be subjected to a saving throw from a spell or effect that deals damage and leaves an area of effect (such as a fireball or a dragon's breath weapon), you can use your reaction to move up to them and have them automatically succeed, even if they already failed. Succeeding in this way allows them to take no damage instead of half, if the effect would make them take half on a success. When you do this, you are then subjected to the effect if you weren't already and make the save at disadvantage.

feat.name: Field Medic
entries: You can expertly treat the wounds of a dying creature in the midst of battle. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks made to stabilize a dying creature.
When you stabilize a dying creature using a Wisdom (Medicine) check, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

feat.name: Hoard Slayer
entries: Through progressive training and keen perception, you are especially well-versed in keeping up in battle, even when surrounded.

items: The penalty to your AC you incur when being flanked is halved. (If you do not receive a penalty to AC when flanked, you instead gain a +2 bonus to AC when you are flanked.)
When being flanked, you have advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures who are within 5 feet of you.

feat.name: Two-Weapon Master
entries: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren't light.
When using two-weapon fighting with your attack action, the damage you inflict with your melee weapons increases by +1 at level 5, +2 at level 11, and +3 at level 17.

feat.name: Flanking Expert
entries: When in battle, sometimes coordinating with your allies is the most important thing to consider. As such, you've learned how to best work with your allies in the heat of battle.

items: When you are flanking an enemy, that enemy receives an additional -1 penalty to its AC.
When you are flanking an enemy you can use the Help action as a bonus action, but only to give an ally advantage on an attack roll against the flanked enemy.

feat.name: Fiendish Touched
entries: You've been blessed with demonic or infernal powers as you've been permanently changed by fiendish magic. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell suggestion} spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=E;I} must be from the enchantment or illusion school of magic. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Infernal Resilience
entries: Fiendish blood runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by some fiends. You gain the following benefits:

items: Choose two from cold, fire, and poison. You have resistance to the chosen damage types.
Damage that you take from the chosen resistances, and the one provided by your race, is reduced by 3.

feat.name: Dual Gunslinger
entries: You have expert training with wielding and reloading two firearms at the same time, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can reload two firearms as part of the same action or bonus action.
You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed firearms aren't light.
When using two-weapon fighting with your attack action, the damage you inflict with your firearms increases by +1 at level 5, +2 at level 11, and +3 at level 17.

feat.name: Quickdraw
entries: You're quick to react and swap weapons on the fly for something that packs more of a punch. You gain the following benefits:

items: You ignore the loading and reload properties of firearms.
In response to being targeted by a ranged attack, you can draw a firearm and make a ranged attack against the attacker, or just make an attack with a firearm if you already had one drawn.

feat.name: Favored Worshiper
entries: A divine being has chosen you to carry a small portion of their power. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the cleric spell list and one 1st-level spell based on the domain of your deity, as specified in the Domain Spells table below. You also learn the {@spell Augury} spell.

You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell and the {@spell augury} spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

entries.caption: Domain Spells
rows: Choose one {@filter 1st-level druid or ranger spell|spells|level=1|class=druid;ranger}.

entries: In addition, you can use a {@item holy symbol|phb} as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses the spellcasting ability you choose when you select this feat.

feat.name: Divine Consort
entries: Your divine entity is pleased with your efforts, and grants you a larger portion of their power, giving you the following benefits:

items.name: Divine Magic
entries: You learn one 2nd level spell from the same spell lists given by your Domain chosen from your Favored Worshiper feat. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the Favored Worshiper feat.

items.name: Channel Divine Power
entries: You gain the ability to harness divine power given by your divine entity. As a bonus action, roll a number of d10s equal to your proficiency bonus. You can grant a creature within 30 feet of you (you can choose yourself) temporary hit points equal to the total plus your proficiency bonus. Once you've done so, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. If you have the Channel Divinity feature from either the cleric or paladin classes, this becomes a channel divinity option and you gain one additional use of your channel divinity, which replenishes after you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Arcane Initiate
entries: You've spent a great deal of time learning about the various arcane arts, perhaps even teaching it. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list and one 1st-level spell based on the area of study, as specified in the Area of Study Spells table below. You also learn the {@spell Detect Magic} spell.

You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell and the {@spell detect magic} spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

entries.caption: Areas of Study Spells
rows: Choose one {@filter 1st-level cleric or druid spell|spells|level=1|class=cleric;druid}.
Choose one {@filter 1st-level bard or warlock spell|spells|level=1|class=bard;warlock}.

feat.name: Arcane Adept
entries: Your research has developed further, expanding your ability to cast magic, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Studious Magic
entries: You learn one 2nd level spell from the same spell lists given by your Area of Study chosen from your Arcane Initiate feat. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell's spellcasting ability is the one chosen when you gained the Arcane Initiate feat.

items.name: Magical Surge
entries: As a reaction when you cast a spell, you can channel magic through your body to strengthen the potency of it momentarily. Until the start of your next turn, the spell you cast is treated as if you cast it using a spell slot one level higher. You can use this benefit twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Each time you use this benefit, you gain one level of exhaustion.

feat.name: Masquerader
entries: You are a master of disguise and deceit, constantly acquiring different titles and aliases. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with a {@item Disguise Kit|phb} if you don't already have it.

With one hour of work or when you finish a long rest, you can create a number of uncanny disguises equal to your proficiency bonus. Occupation of the disguise determines the cost of materials for making them. The occupation table below lists the prices for each disguise. Each disguise is expertly made with extra time dedicated to them. While wearing one of these disguises, a creature is given a bonus to their Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks to look like a member of that occupation equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Adept Trickster
entries: With an uncanny understanding of criminal activity and specialized training, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb} if you don't already have it.

If you roll a 5 or lower on the d20 for an ability check using your thieves' tools, a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}), or a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check, you can use your reaction to reroll the d20. You must use the new result when you use this feature.

feat.name: Master Performer
entries: You know how to please a crowd of people and keep the attention on you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks made when trying to entertain a crowd or draw attention towards you.

When you use the help action to distract a creature and give an ally advantage on an attack roll, you can do so from up to 60 feet away from the target being distracted, provided they can hear or see you.

feat.name: Heroic Stalwart
entries: You are defined as a hero to certain communities, a mantle of inspiration to yourself and your allies with a defining moment granting you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid being {@condition frightened}.

When you, or an ally that can see you, fails an ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to reroll the d20, taking the higher result. You can provide this benefit twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Adept Artisan
entries: You've spent an exceptional amount of time learning and mastering certain crafts, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in one tool of your choice.

Choose one tool in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that tool, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The tool you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Secluded Researcher
entries: You lived in isolation for a time where you focused entirely on researching a particular field of study, granting you the following benefits:

items: By spending at least 10 minutes you can enter a state of keen focus, giving you advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks for the next hour. During this time, you cannot concentrate on spells. If you take damage while in this state, you must make a concentration check as if you were concentrating on a spell. If you fail, your state of focus immediately ends.
You have advantage on ability checks made when participating in the Research Downtime Activity, provided you do so in total isolation.

feat.name: Favored Consort
entries: You've spent time around nobility or served as nobility yourself, gaining a certain level of confidence and valor, granting you the following benefits:

items: If you roll a 5 or lower on the d20 for a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you can spend your reaction to reroll the d20. You must use the new result when you use this feature.
You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks made to recall information on nobility and royalty within your country.

feat.name: Wild Instincts
entries: You've spent time around nobility or served as nobility yourself, gaining a certain level of confidence and valor, granting you the following benefits:

items: If you roll a 5 or lower on the d20 for an Initiative check, you can reroll the d20. You must use the new result when you use this feature.
You have advantage on ability checks made to track, hunt, scavenge, and to make camouflage with the natural terrain (such as bushes, dirt, mud, etc).

feat.name: Sea Legged
entries: You've gained experience sailing on a ship and lugging around cargo, granting you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone, pushed, or dragged.
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. If you already have a feature providing this benefit, you do not benefit from it again.

feat.name: War Trained
entries: You've been trained in the art of war either serving as a soldier or being mentored by one, granting you the following benefits:

items: You choose two martial or simple weapons. You gain proficiency with them if you didn't already have it, also you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls made with those weapons.

items.name: War Cry
entries: As a bonus action, you release outward a powerful war cry to inspire you and your allies. Roll {@dice 1d10} and add your proficiency bonus, you and each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you gain temporary hit points equal to the result and they have advantage on their next attack roll. You can use this benefit twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Streetwise
entries: You've experienced a wretched lifestyle on the streets, having to fend for yourself oftentimes, granting you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to determine if someone is lying.

You have a particular artistry for making scams and conning people out of money for your own benefit. While in a populated area, you can spend an hour of work attempting to scam people. Make a Charisma (Deception) check with a flat DC of 15 (the DM may introduce higher or lower DCs depending on certain circumstances). On a success, you can earn a number of gp equal to 10 times your proficiency bonus. On a fail, you make half as much, unless you fail by 5 or more, which earns you nothing.

feat.name: Ki Expert
entries: Your meditation and practice has allowed you to channel the magical life energies of ki. You gain 2 ki points, which replenish after a short or long rest. You can use these ki points for any features that uses ki, or for one of the following features by spending 1 ki point for each:

items.name: Ki Strike
entries: When you hit with a weapon or spell attack, you can expend a ki point to add an additional damage die to the attack.

items.name: Ki Protection
entries: When you would be hit by an attack, you can expend a ki point as a reaction to add a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus against the triggering attack, potentially causing the attack to miss.
You can take this feat multiple times, gaining an additional 2 ki points each time you do.

variantrule.name: Bonus Action Options
entries: There are many actions to take in combat, such as dodge, help, shove, etc. However the amount of bonus actions are a little more limited. The options provided are going to be a list of options to make into bonus actions for use in combat.

entries.name: Drink a Potion
entries: Simply put, you can drink any type of potion as a bonus action, unless it specifically states otherwise. You can also use an action to drink a potion as normal.

entries.name: Draw or Stow a Weapon
entries: In addition to your free object interaction, you can use a bonus action to draw or stow an additional weapon. You can use an action to draw or stow a weapon as normal.

entries.name: Light Dash
entries: While using your movement, you can use your bonus action to move an additional 10 feet as part of that movement. You can perform this bonus action only if you have not used the dash action, and you cannot take the dash action after performing this bonus action.

entries.name: Non-Lethal Attack
entries: You can make a weapon attack using a melee weapon or unarmed strike and land a non-lethal blow. Roll the attack and damage rolls as normal, but you only reduce its hit points if the damage would reduce the target's hit points to 0. The attack is always considered non-lethal.

entries.name: Brace
entries: You can use a hit die to brace yourself against a powerful attack as a bonus action. The next time you take damage that would equal or exceed the maximum roll of the chosen hit die (not including your Constitution modifier) from a single source, you can roll the hit die and reduce that damage by an amount equal to the roll. You spend the hit die only if you rolled it before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Magical Transmuter
entries: You can alter the way you cast spells unlike any other. When you cast a spell, you can choose to change its or your own properties in one of the following ways:

items: If it deals damage, you can change the damage type to force, radiant, or necrotic.
If it requires a saving throw, you can change the ability used for the save to a different one, such as changing Fireball from being a Dexterity saving throw to being a Constitution saving throw.
If it deals damage, you can gain resistance to that damage type for 1 minute.

entries: You can use these benefits a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rune Magic
entries: You learn one cantrip from the school of magic chosen by your birthmark. At 3rd level, you can learn one 1st level spell from the artificer or wizard spell lists. Starting at 5th level, you can learn one 2nd level spell from the artificer or wizard spell lists. You can cast either of these spells without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level and the appropriate material components needed, if any.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Limited Magic Resistance
entries: You can use a reaction when you would take damage from a spell or be forced to make a saving throw by a spell. You can gain resistance to the spell's damage or gain advantage on the saving throw of the spell.
You can use this feature once, regaining the ability to use it again when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Shadow Resistance
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

entries.name: Shadow Magic
entries: You can become a shadow momentarily to quickly move around and evade being seen. As a bonus action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn after you use this ability, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

At 5th level, you can cast the {@spell pass without trace} spell once without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. Once you cast it, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: One with the Shadows
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Shadow Rejuvenation
entries: You do not need to eat, drink, or sleep. You also finish a long rest while in complete darkness after 4 hours. Taking a short rest while not in direct sunlight allows you to regain 1 additional hit point when you spend hit dice, per hit die spent.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

In Torin, the first Shadow-Born came to be when humans made deals with shadow demons for power and extended lifespans. Now after many years they've formed a society within the underdark, and often become expert spies and assassins.
Shadow-Borns mature at the same rate as humans do, but rarely age past adulthood. They do not suffer the frailty of old age but they do die after 200 years of life.

Shadow-Born in their true form look like humanoids but have pure black or dark gray skin and are opaque. Shadow-Born are very slim in body structure and usually have hard to see facial features - usually outlined in either white or yellow.

The intermingling of races is an occurrence quite common among the people of Torin, as unity between nations has been very historically present. Oftentimes, this means that kings and queens are of different races, thus leading to the people of that nation to do the same.
Without that incentive, love can be found in all shapes and sizes, so understandably this can result in a half-born child.

items.name: Variable Trait; Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} with a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Variable Trait; Versatile
entries: You can gain proficiency in one weapon or tool.

entries.name: Age
entries: You age and mature at the same rate as a human, but your lifespan is half of that of your longest living parent or ancestor. For example, if your parents or ancestors are humans and elves, you would approximately live to be as old as 325.

entries.name: Parental Legacy
entries: Choose two skills to gain proficiency in. In addition, you can choose a legacy for your half-born from a large variety.

Choose two races that are not already considered to be a mix of two races, for example you cannot choose Half Elf or Half orc. Shifter, Firbolg, and Changelings are also examples as ones you cannot pick, however Goliath is a valid option. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can choose one feature from each race and you are considered as those races for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be that race.

If either of the chosen races has any of the Fey Ancestry, Amphibious, Chromatic Ancestry, Metallic Ancestry, or Gem Ancestry traits, you automatically gain that trait, which doesn't count toward the benefit above.
If either of the chosen races has a special speed, a faster walking speed or a swimming speed for instance, you choose one of them to gain.

entries.name: Variable Trait
entries: You gain one of the following options of your choice:

items.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Versatile
entries: You can gain proficiency in one weapon or tool.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Blessed with a radiant soul, your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Celestial Resistance
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus hit points. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Guardian's Magic
entries: You know the {@spell resistance} cantrip. You can cast it as normal, and you can also cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sanctuary} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell aid} spell with this trait. Once you cast {@spell sanctuary} or {@spell aid} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Guardian's Revelation
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your bonus action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed of 30 feet and when you heal a creature with a spell or with your healing hands feature, you can add your proficiency bonus to the total number healed.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Protector aasimar are charged by the powers of good to guard the weak, to strike at evil wherever it arises, and to stand vigilant against the darkness. From a young age, a protector aasimar receives advice and directives that urge to stand against evil. Aasimar age and mature at the same rate as humans, but they typically live for about 160 years.
In Torin, protector aasimar usually have guiding devas from Pelor or Bahamut and may grant their aasimar sun shaped halos or patches of platinum scales.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Cursed with the shadowy embrace of your dark origins, your vision is more adapted to darkness. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Shadow Touch
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and inflict a temporary curse that grants them part of your dark power. The next time they deal damage to a creature with an attack or spell, they can add a number of d4s of extra necrotic damage to one of the rolls equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Fallen Magic
entries: You know the {@spell toll the dead|XGE} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell bane} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell with this trait. Once you cast {@spell bane} or {@spell darkness} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Dark Revelation
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your bonus action to unleash the shadow magic within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness. The instant you transform, creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you can deal extra necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.
The DC for this trait is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race).
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

An aasimar who was touched by dark powers as a youth or who turns to evil in early adulthood can become one of the fallen-a group of aasimar whose inner light has been replaced by shadow. Aasimar age and mature at the same rate as humans, but they typically live for about 160 years.

In Torin, typically fallen aasimar are ones tainted by cultists at a young age or ones that are born or influenced by the shadowfell. Devas of The Raven Queen or evil gods can also make fallen aasimar. As such, most of these aasimar take a pale deathly visage and shadowy black eyes.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Blessed with overflowing radiant energy, your vision cuts through darkness with ease. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Fiery Retaliation
entries: As a reaction when you take damage by a creature within 30 feet of you, you can invoke a burning divine power to retaliate against a foe who dares to challenge you. Roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. That creature takes an amount of fire or radiant damage (you choose when you use this trait) equal to the roll. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Scourge Magic
entries: You know the {@spell produce flame} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell divine favor} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell flame blade} spell with this trait and you can choose to make it deal radiant damage on hit instead of fire. Once you cast {@spell divine favor} or {@spell flame blade} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
