entries.name: Feature: Researcher
entries: When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature. Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.

entries.name: Specialty
entries: To determine the nature of your scholarly training, roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below.

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat Arcane Initiate|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Magic Initiate|phb}, {@feat Ritual Caster|phb}, {@feat Spell Sniper|phb}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Sages are defined by their extensive studies, and their characteristics reflect this life of study. Devoted to scholarly pursuits, a sage values knowledge highlysometimes in its own right, sometimes as a means toward other ideals.

rows: I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
I've read every book in the world's greatest librariesor I like to boast that I have.
I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
I... speak... slowly... when talking... to idiots,... which... almost... everyone... is... compared... to me.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
Beauty. What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)
Logic. Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)
No Limits. Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)
Power. Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Evil)
Self-Improvement. The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)
It is my duty to protect my students.
I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.
I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
I can't keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else's.

entries: You spent years learning the lore of the multiverse. You scoured manuscripts, studied scrolls, and listened to the greatest experts on the subjects that interest you. Your efforts have made you a master in your fields of study.

items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Perception}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:

entries.name: Feature: Ship's Passage
entries: When you need to, you can secure free passage on a sailing ship for yourself and your adventuring companions. You might sail on the ship you served on, or another ship you have good relations with (perhaps one captained by a former crewmate). Because you're calling in a favor, you can't be certain of a schedule or route that will meet your every need. Your Dungeon Master will determine how long it takes to get where you need to go. In return for your free passage, you and your companions are expected to assist the crew during the voyage.

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat Sea Legged|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Defensive Duelist|phb}, {@feat Mobile|phb}, {@feat Tough|phb}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Sailors can be a rough lot, but the responsibilities of life on a ship make them generally reliable as well. Life aboard a ship shapes their outlook and forms their most important attachments.

rows: My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
I never pass up a friendly wager.
My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
Respect. The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
Fairness. We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
Freedom. The sea is freedomthe freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
Mastery. I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
People. I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Aspiration. Someday, I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
I'm loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
The ship is most importantcrewmates and captains come and go.
I'll always remember my first ship.
In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
My pride will probably lead to my destruction.

entries: You sailed on a seagoing vessel for years. In that time, you faced down mighty storms, monsters of the deep, and those who wanted to sink your craft to the bottomless depths. Your first love is the distant line of the horizon, but the time has come to try your hand at something new.

Discuss the nature of the ship you previously sailed with your Dungeon Master. Was it a merchant ship, a naval vessel, a ship of discovery, or a pirate ship? How famous (or infamous) is it? Is it widely traveled? Is it still sailing, or is it missing and presumed lost with all hands?
What were your duties on boardboatswain, captain, navigator, cook, or some other position? Who were the captain and first mate? Did you leave your ship on good terms with your fellows, or on the run?

items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Perception}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:
items.entry: {@item Navigator's tools|phb}, {@filter vehicles (water)|items|source=phb;dmg|miscellaneous=mundane|type=vehicle (water)}

items.entry: A belaying pin ({@item club|phb}), {@item silk rope (50 feet)|phb}, a lucky charm such as a rabbit foot or a small stone with a hole in the center (or you may roll for a random {@item trinket|phb} on the Trinkets table in chapter 5), a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt {@item pouch|phb} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Bad Reputation
entries: No matter where you go, people are afraid of you due to your reputation. When you are in a civilized settlement, you can get away with minor criminal offenses, such as refusing to pay for food at a tavern or breaking down doors at a local shop, since most people will not report your activity to the authorities.

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat Sea Legged|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Defensive Duelist|phb}, {@feat Mobile|phb}, {@feat Tough|phb}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Sailors can be a rough lot, but the responsibilities of life on a ship make them generally reliable as well. Life aboard a ship shapes their outlook and forms their most important attachments.

rows: My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
I never pass up a friendly wager.
My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
Respect. The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
Fairness. We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
Freedom. The sea is freedomthe freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
Mastery. I'm a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
People. I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Aspiration. Someday, I'll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
I'm loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
The ship is most importantcrewmates and captains come and go.
I'll always remember my first ship.
In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
I follow orders, even if I think they're wrong.
I'll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
I can't help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
My pride will probably lead to my destruction.

entries: You spent your youth under the sway of a dread pirate, a ruthless cutthroat who taught you how to survive in a world of sharks and savages. You've indulged in larceny on the high seas and sent more than one deserving soul to a briny grave. Fear and bloodshed are no strangers to you, and you've garnered a somewhat unsavory reputation in many a port town.
If you decide that your sailing career involved piracy, you can choose the Bad Reputation feature instead of the Ship's Passage feature.

_.special: trophy taken from a fallen enemy (a dagger, broken blade, or piece of a banner)

items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:
items.entry: One type of {@filter gaming set|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=gaming set}, {@filter vehicles (land)|items|source=phb;dmg|miscellaneous=mundane|type=vehicle (land)}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: An insignia of rank, a trophy taken from a fallen enemy (a {@item dagger|phb}, broken blade, or piece of a banner), a bone {@item dice set|phb} or {@item playing card set|phb}, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt {@item pouch|phb} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Military Rank
entries: You have a military rank from your career as a soldier. Soldiers loyal to your former military organization still recognize your authority and influence, and they defer to you if they are of a lower rank. You can invoke your rank to exert influence over other soldiers and requisition simple equipment or horses for temporary use. You can also usually gain access to friendly military encampments and fortresses where your rank is recognized.

entries.name: Specialty
entries: During your time as a soldier, you had a specific role to play in your unit or army. Roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your role:

rows: Support staff (cook, blacksmith, or the like)

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat War Trained|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Healer|phb}, {@feat Tough|phb}, {@feat War Caster|phb}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: The horrors of war combined with the rigid discipline of military service leave their mark on all soldiers, shaping their ideals, creating strong bonds, and often leaving them scarred and vulnerable to fear, shame, and hatred.

rows: I'm haunted by memories of war. I can't get the images of violence out of my mind.
I've lost too many friends, and I'm slow to make new ones.
I'm full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
Might. In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
Live and Let Live. Ideals aren't worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
Nation. My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)
I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
I'll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many livesand I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
My hatred of my enemies is blinding and unreasoning.
I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
I'd rather eat my armor than admit when I'm wrong.

entries: War has been your life for as long as you care to remember. You trained as a youth, studied the use of weapons and armor, learned basic survival techniques, including how to stay alive on the battlefield. You might have been part of a standing national army or a mercenary company, or perhaps a member of a local militia who rose to prominence during a recent war.

When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine which military organization you were a part of, how far through its ranks you progressed, and what kind of experiences you had during your military career. Was it a standing army, a town guard, or a village militia? Or it might have been a noble's or merchant's private army, or a mercenary company.

_.special: map of the city you grew up in
token to remember your parents by

items.entry: {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Stealth}

items.entry: {@item Disguise kit|phb}, {@item Thieves' tools|phb}

items.entry: A small knife, a map of the city you grew up in, a pet mouse, a token to remember your parents by, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt {@item pouch|phb} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: City Secrets
entries: You know the secret patterns and flow to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you (and companions you lead) can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat Streetwise|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Defensive Duelist|phb}, {@feat Mobile|phb}, {@feat Skulker|phb}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Urchins are shaped by lives of desperate poverty, for good and for ill. They tend to be driven either by a commitment to the people with whom they shared life on the street or by a burning desire to find a better lifeand maybe get some payback on all the rich people who treated them badly.

rows: I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
I ask a lot of questions.
I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.
I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
I think anyone who's nice to me is hiding evil intent.
I bluntly say what others are hinting at or hiding.
Respect. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)
Community. We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)
Change. The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)
Retribution. The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Evil)
People. I help the people who help methat's what keeps us alive. (Neutral)
Aspiration. I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life. (Any)
My town or city is my home, and I'll fight to defend it.
I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure.
I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.
I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I'm wanted for it.
No one else should have to endure the hardships I've been through.
If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.
Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I'll do just about anything for more of it.
I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
I'd rather kill someone in their sleep than fight fair.
It's not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.

entries: You grew up on the streets alone, orphaned, and poor. You had no one to watch over you or to provide for you, so you learned to provide for yourself. You fought fiercely over food and kept a constant watch out for other desperate souls who might steal from you. You slept on rooftops and in alleyways, exposed to the elements, and endured sickness without the advantage of medicine or a place to recuperate. You've survived despite all odds, and did so through cunning, strength, speed, or some combination of each.

You begin your adventuring career with enough money to live modestly but securely for at least ten days. How did you come by that money? What allowed you to break free of your desperate circumstances and embark on a better life?

_.special: A uniform in the style of your community and indicative of your role

_.displayName: horn with which to summon help

entries.name: Feature: Guard Role
entries: Every member of the city guard has a role given to them based on their training and experience.

entries.name: Trainees
entries: A trainee, as the name implies, is a guard in training. Trainees have the lowest ranking in authority due to naivety, lack of experience, and lack of relations with the guard force. This isn't to say they aren't respected, but they are more likely to be disrespected by other guards and the community.

entries.name: Captains
entries: A captain is a well respected and seasoned member of the guards, likely been around the longest and is typically in charge of hiring volunteers and stationing existing guards by assigning their roles and positions. Despite what one would expect, captains do not get paid any differently from even a trainee despite the increased workload, leaving little incentive to seek becoming a captain in the first place.

entries.name: Investigators
entries: Sometimes crimes go initially unnoticed and need some investigation to solve the mysteries within these crimes. Unlike a private investigator, you work primarily for the guard and do not get paid any differently from the other guard roles.

entries.name: Healers
entries: Whenever there are major injuries inflicted upon other guards or citizens caught in the crossfire of crimes and monster attacks, healers within the guard are quick to come to their aid. This role is more rare to see, but not unheard of.

entries.name: Defenders
entries: More aligned with what everyone expects and associates with guards, these are the surveyors of the local community, strategically stationed to patrol around busier sections of the community to keep a watchful eye for crime and dangerous activity. They help defend the city against monster attacks and use force if they must to stop criminals.

entries.name: Arcane Associates
entries: An extremely rare role within guards, typically more common among larger cities or capitals, but this is typically someone who is well versed with magic. Whether they use magic themselves or simply know a lot about it, arcane associates help determine whether certain magic was used in a crime and how it was used. Most arcane associates are wizards or artificers, but are not limited to those classifications.
Roll a d6 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your role:

rows: I don't get paid enough to deal with you, so don't give me any trouble.
If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend help.
I ask a lot of questions.
There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
Power. We can do what we want when we are the law, and we can get away with it too. (Evil)
Live and Let Live. Ideals aren't worth killing over. (Neutral)
Nation. My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)
I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
My community took care of me when I had no one. To this day, I swear to protect them.
A guard saved my life once, they inspired me to be the person I am now.
Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
I'd rather eat my armor than admit when I'm wrong.
It's always happy hour somewhere right? You got a drink on ya..?
Despite being an enforcer of it, sometimes I can't help myself but break a law or two.
Yeah, yeah, sure you did nothing wrong. Guilty until proven innocent.
There is nothing greater than the law, and I am the law.

entries: You have served the community where you grew up, standing as its first line of defense against crime and other dangerous activity. Most guards have standardized combat and observational training, which includes primarily weapon training and how to keep a sharp eye for trouble.

Though the name implies it, this background is not limited to large cities. Any community that is large enough, such as a small town or even a village, can have guards or law enforcement of some kind. Regardless of origin, guards are not paid extremely well. Most are volunteers trying to do good for their community. Though, all guards are given external benefits from good pay, such as reduced cost for healing at their local churches, a decreased tax on property owned locally, and other benefits.

Some guards take up certain roles and are not all limited to patrolling and keeping watch, implying that while all guards receive the standard training, it may not be as equally distributed or necessarily required in certain areas. When you choose this background, work with your DM to determine which role you may have had during your time as a guard.

entries.name: Feature: Sheltered Heritage
entries: You have the eyes and presence of someone who has lived in a sheltered community, which is perceivable by others with this presence. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free shelter, healing, and care at a monastic temple, though you must provide any material components needed for spells.

You might also have ties to your specific monastery, and you may have a residence there. If you remain on good terms with them, you can call on other disciples for assistance in taks, provided the assistance you ask for is not too hazardous and you remain in good standing with your monastery.

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat Secluded Researcher|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Healer|phb}, {@feat Martial Adept|phb}, {@feat Style Master|TACS}.

rows: I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
I connect everything that happens to me to a grand, cosmic plan.
I've spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.
I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
I've been isolated for so long that I rarely speak, preferring gestures and the occasional grunt.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
I am utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
I am working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing my ideas.
Greater Good. My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit. (Good)
Logic. Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking. (Lawful)
Free Thinking. Inquiry and curiosity are the pillars of progress. (Chaotic)
Power. Through my studies, I believe everyone should follow this philosophy. Only then, can we have a perfect world. (Evil)
Live and Let Live. Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble. (Neutral)
Self-Knowledge. If you know yourself, there's nothing left to know. (Any)
I entered the monastery to hide from the ones who might still be hunting me. I must someday confront them.
I'm still seeking enlightenment, and it still eludes me.
My master saved my life one day when I was in danger, and now I owe my life to them and their teachings.
I'm on a journey to find myself and my purpose in life.
A friend of mine joined a monastery and I wanted to learn why they did, I still wish to understand it.
I was told I could learn martial arts by joining a monastery, but now I have a new philosophy.
I find it hard to resist my own desires, I mean, shouldn't we be allowed happiness every now and then?
I solve all my problems by punching them, I've found myself to be quite violent despite my master's teachings.
I feel the lessons I've learned are mandatory and try to enforce it on others.
I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
I like keeping secrets and won't share them with anyone.
Now that I've returned to the world, I enjoy its delights a little too much.

entries: You were a member of a monastery, which is a type of temple or structure with people who study in preparation for a life of asceticism, which teaches about self discipline and avoidance of worldly pleasures. Most of those who enter a monastery make it their home for the rest of their lives, with the exception of adventurers and others who have reason to leave.

Many monastic disciples become monks, but there are other forms of practices that exist within a monastery. Some druid circles have a very monastic approach for instance, as well as certain religious practices. For this reason, druids and clerics could also come from a monastery.

You were someone from another world or another time, and now for one reason or another you're in the world of Torin. You're unsure of the specifics of how you got here, but this is your life now. Sometimes you have dreams of your old world, events that you were a part of and sometimes events that you were never a part of.
You might also be the soul of someone from another world or time placed in the wrong body, and now you are unsure of who you are and unaware of the world you're in.

items.entry: {@skill Insight}, {@skill Perception}

items.entry: Any one of your choice

items.name: Equipment

entries.name: Feature: Unwanted Attention
entries: Your accent, mannerisms, figures of speech, and perhaps even your appearance all mark you as foreign. Curious glances are directed your way wherever you go, which can be a nuisance, but you also gain the friendly interest of scholars and others intrigued by times of old or far-off worlds, to say nothing of everyday folk who are eager to hear stories of your home world.

You can parley this attention into access to people and places you might not otherwise have, for you and your traveling companions. Noble lords, scholars, and merchant princes, to name a few, might be interested in hearing about your distant homeland and people.

However, being from another world or time can draw the attention of beings beyond the material plane. Deities, creatures from the far realm, and enforcers from Mechanus are drawn to your very nature and potentially seek you out. As such, you're always on the lookout for such creatures.

entries.name: Bonus Feats
entries: When selecting this background, you gain the {@feat Wild Instincts|TACS} feat or you can choose from among these suggested feats: {@feat Lucky|phb}, {@feat Magic Initiate|phb}, {@feat Skilled|phb}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: As someone from an open origin, you should choose your characteristics from another background that makes sense for who you originally were, or perhaps who the body you inhabit is.

language.name: Futhrakian
entries: The futhrakian language is an ancient tongue that's long since been forgotten to time, primarily written in runes and other symbols and has a very harsh tone when spoken.
